review_text: We actually came here on a whim when we found out Millet Crepe (right across the street) opens at 12:30pm. We were all pretty hungry so we decided to head in here and get some food to kill time. While we didn't have a reservation, we were seated pretty quickly and got a table inside.We enjoyed everything we ordered - country fried chicken, chicken and waffles, and the country breakfast. The server was very friendly and offered us recommendations as it was our first time dining at Flores and Sons.It's definitely a cute brunch place and I would love to come back!!

I had lunch at the Tibet Nepal House in Pasadena, CA on 11/23/2013.  It was my first time there.  It is located between the Memorial Park Gold Line Station and the free shuttle at Parsons to the UCLA game at the Rose Bowl.  I've walked by it many times and finally decided to give it a try.  The service was friendly and I decided to try their buffet.  The buffet cost $9.99 and had a wide choice of selections.  Everyone that I tried tasted good.  I also had a Mango Lassi for $2.99.  Hot tea came with the buffet and I was told that the buffet is available seven days a week.

Best service ever. I have never been anywhere where they served us so well. Danny was the guy to go to. He hooked us up and made our experience the best. I will definitely come here again . Price is nothing when they serve you so well. My friend Ivan brought me here to try it out and it was fire!!! We ate beef bulgogi, brisket, chicken, pork belly, intestinal, abumasum, and appetizers, with a pitcher of Lagunitas IPA. All in all we ate for about 2 hours. Bring your girl, your guy, your family , friends, whoever. You'll love this place

Since it's Pasadena, this location gotta appeal to the people who eat a little healthier.I finally got the chance to come here!!! I got the Japanese Miso. it was alright. I will be more daring next time and order something else. The menu was fancy looking. Lunch is $13.99 and dinner is $14.99 if you wanna upgrade it, it's an additional $3.95 or $3.99. I forgot. Since it's organic and supposedly healthier than their other locations, I guess the price justifies. I will come here to try other dishes next time. 5/5 would recommend. Service was great. They were attentive when I came here around 4PM on a Friday. It was not crowded.

Los Angeles Landmark - first saw it when Jerry Seinfeld picked up take-out deli for a video visit with Carl Reiner and Mel Brooks at Carl's home!comediansincarsgettingco We went on Academy Awards day 2015 (I'll post a pic - they had special 'Oscar Hours'), and we had what else?  The Assorted Fish Plate, served with 2 bagels, Lox, Cod, Whitefish, Cream Cheese, Tomato, Onion, Greek Olives and Sliced Cucumbers.  C'mon, it's the ultimate deli - where else you gonna get that??!  We'll be back for some of the other great-lookin' stuff.TIP: free 2-hour underground parking just up the street past the deli.

I've been looking for a cozy study spot in LA, and this is the place! I took the metro here and was able to study and get an awesome drink. The only reason I can't give this place a full 5 stars is because of the fact that their wifi can be spotty and that their drinks are a pricey. I ended up spending $6.75 on a house-made cashew milk iced latte with sea salt caramel, which I guess makes sense for a coffee shop in LA. The coffee here is strong and it kept me motivated to work, and I love the work vibes here! I Definitely want to try their espresso shake, considering they have a vegan version!

ORIGINALLY IT WAS A 1 STAR. Here's the story Waited 1hr 30min for a party of 6 and they tried to have us sit at two SEPARATE tables for a birthday party. we asked if it was possible to have one table and they said sure it should be a short wait. We waited another hour. Basically a 2 hour. We were pissed until Betsy, Jaquay, and Shawn made it clear there was a small mistake and had impeccable customer service. We will be back because of the three of them. As for SARAH fix your attitude and smile more. Follow me on IG GloTaylorr

So I guess before I write this review I should clarify that it was really my mom who devoured the crepe from here and she loved every bite of it! We went to Anaheim packing district a couple of weeks ago and she still brings up how much she wants to go back and get it again.She ordered the green tea ice cream crepe and as someone who was been Europe and had the real deal, she says it's definitely up to par. It has just the right amount of sweetness.Maybe next time I visit again, I might just get my own!

This spot was first on our list for our mini food tour. We ended up parking on one of the meters up front. This place is located inside Milk Tavern. There were plenty of tables and seats. We ended up ordering two sandwiches for the three of us. We went with the Avo Egg and the Royal West Sandwiches. Avo egg, in my opinion, was great. It's simple but super yummy. The meat on the Royal West tasted good. This restaurant reminds me of Egg Slut without the wait. It wasn't busy when we arrived but we were there close to closing time. Great place to get a breakfast sandwich if you're cravings for some good cooking eggs.

From the moment you walk into Patina till the moment you walk out, YOU ARE PAMPERED. The service staff was amazing and they carried out their tasks with smile on their faces. Patina is a classic place where one can enjoy a relaxed time and carry a quite talk with friends. It is a great place to spend a couple of hours before the concert. We had quality time with our friends without a need to scream our lungs out. They validated the Valet parking ticket, but added the fee to our tab. Overall; we had a great time and will visit again if we have time to kill before a concert or a show.

What a hidden gem! We were looking for some dessert after eating dinner nearby. After browsing through Yelp, we spotted these mesmerizing decorations and had to try it out! They are located in the corner inside another restaurant. Spot the chocolate fountain and you'll be in the right spot. We ordered the Special Belgian Crepe to share. It takes a little bit to make it, probably due to the design, but it's soo cool! The fresh fruits really help the richness of the chocolate. The crepe itself was a little bit too dough-y for my liking. Overall, this is a great spot to share desserts. They have a lot of unique creations, such a crepe sushi, crepe pasta, etc.

I will definitely be back for the pulled pork nachos, these are huge! I'd say enough for 3 to share. The two of us also shared a combo plate with spareribs, sausage, and brisket. The barbeque was OK, a little dry but I guess that's why they have bbq/ spicy bbq sauces on the table. Back to the pulled pork nachos, there was a ton of meat on here, nachos were perfectly crisp, topped with pork, beans, guac, bbq sauce, and pico de gallo I believe. I don't know... just order it!!!Verdict - I would be back for the nachos. Did I mention the pulled pork nachos?

First time here and the food was amazing! Our server JudyAnn went above and beyond to cater to 6 hungry adults LOL. I wasn't expecting to prepare the meats and vegetables ourselves but it was a cool experience. I'm not much of a cook myself so I wasn't keen on having to roll up my sleeves and slave over the hot stove in the middle of our table to prepare dinner. Our server JudyAnn hooked us up with some additional plates because we had no place to put the cooked meats when there became a surplus at our table. Nonetheless, flavors were good and the sauces were outstanding! Would definitely recommend

I was in town for New Year's Eve and staying at an air B&B nearby. I found The Bird's Nest Cafe on yelp. I was looking for something healthy and fresh I could eat before the show. I ordered the Cobb Salad. I was not disappointed. This restaurant is new, clean and the employees and chef really care about what they are doing. There aren't many seats inside or out so you might have to ask to share a table with strangers, but that's okay because you can make new friends. I enjoyed my visit and will be back.

This place is AMAZING! Went last night with my boyfriend and we were pleasantly surprised by the beer selection and the service. You can try an array of beer without the side eyes that many bartenders give you when you want a sample. The food is amazing, we recommend their burger and chicken sandwich. One thing I would warn y'all on is the cheese and meat platter. It was very small then other gastro pubs usually serve with very very thin slices of meat and tiny squares of cheese. My bf thought it sounded good and had to order the chicken sandwich because it didn't fill him at all

I was blown away by this place. As soon as we walked in we were greeted nicely and amazed by how many different gelato flavors there were! AND you can get your gelato served on top/with a crepe or waffle!! Trust me, DO IT. I have only eaten the gelato but I'm sure you will not be disappointed with the other options they have. Their gelato is so good that it barley feels like you've eaten anything at all (which is DANGEROUS;) ). This place is great! Definitely check it out if you like gelato, waffles, crepes, milkshakes and ice cream.

Adorable spot that looks like a train station from the outdoors. I believe it once was.  It is is located near the metro and the signs don't scream 'groundwork' so you can get a bit lost.  The inside decor is so lovely, with an extremely rustic feel with the interior design completely of antique tables, and furniture. Tables set with a clear vase and fresh flowers. They have food, and organic coffee that is delicious. The baristas are wonderful and fast.  What more can you want?The crowd you expect is casual, noho arts, hipsteresque adults and some there on business breaks. Not overly packed and plenty of seating areas inside and out.

This place lives up to its reputation for sure! Their dips ate so delicious and their sides are amazing. When we go I have to have at least two sides with my meal. And if you'd like a beer with your drink they have several options to choose from. Even if it looks busy, the fact that they have multiple check out lines will get you paid and seated quickly. And don't worry about seating, they have many seats to choose from. If you have not been here yet, I suggest you take a visit and enjoy their famous food.

Atmosphere is great! Both employees a man and a woman were very nice and allowed my dog to go inside just to order by we ate outside by choice! I ordered the strawberry Nutella crepe and it was pretty good. They wrap it in a convenient little wrapping so we could enjoy it. The only reason for not having 5 stars is that I feel like it was lacking some toppings since I tasted the crepe more than the toppings. Very small location but they have counter seating and outside seating overlooking everything happening on Hollywood Blvd. overall I recommend this place!

I enjoyed dinner here tonight.  There is a cool atmosphere of brick inside and sidewalk tables along Ventura Blvd.  They have upbeat music playing.The menu is diverse, with many choices.  I tried the beef fajitas, which were quite tasty.  Who doesn't like saut ed red and green bell peppers and carmelized onions.  Throw in some steak and good corn tortillas and your all set.Service is walk up and order style, they give you a number then find you and bring it to your table.  They are friendly and I enjoyed my table on the sidewalk, even though there was heavy traffic on The Blvd.

Don't judge the restaurant by the nearby location& atmosphere!!We were looking for a persian restaurant around this area while visiting and almost turned back when we saw how bad the area was. But the restaurant completely flipped our prejudgement! Food is amazing!!!!!! Really really amazing! The Koobideh( ground beef kebab) will just melt in your mouth, and the chicken is so juicy! By far, it's one of the excellent persian restaurants I've been to. The owner is super friendly, since I'm not persian he was explaining tonnes of stuff to me and took extra care that we had a good time!

I've been hearing a lot about the Crave Caf  and their famous well crepes!! We had the breakfast crepe, Italian omelet, and 2 strawberry banana crepes and it was heaven!! I was a little afraid it might be crazy crowded since this place is so popular but it was just right! I ordered and had my food ready in less than 10 min. The people here are extremely nice too! They were extremely helpful in helping me make my decision which was hard because there is so much!! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area!! Thank you Crepe Caf

Flea market of food! You have the Asian, the Cajun, the seafood, the Mexican and so much more!I'd come here with a date, a friend, multiple friends, multiple dates, family, neighbors and more. I think it's cute and fun and everyone is just happy to be there to eat. Hard to have an actual recommendation as I only tried Lobsterdamus. It's expensive for the flea market vibe and just ok lobster. Expect to wait in some lines for longer than 30 minutes AND the line in the parking structure took us over an hour to get out at 3PM. Try coming early and leaving early before it closes.

Chitchat is so cute! There is a dog-friendly patio and during the hot summer days, they even made sure that there were ice cubes in the doggie water bowl!The matcha was pretty good quality and I would definitely return next time to try the coffee. Pastries were from Pitchoun in downtown LA (which I love), so I was pretty excited to eat some deliciousness. There is also a wide variety of pastries to choose from (over 15 different ones). There was plenty of metered parking nearby, which is also free on Sundays. Looking forward to returning to try other items!

Do you want to feel like a KING? Come here for lunch!I bet it's better eating there but I had the to-go lunch special of bossam. That was the biggest carryout bag I've ever carried for $11!!!The food is top notch Korean. Just like home. Banchan is all on point! Beautiful! Fresh! And made by people with the skills to!Just look at my uploaded picture. Need I say more?Best lunch special in Koreatown. If there's anything better, please message me so I can see if this wooly mammoth of a lunch special Korean restaurant can be taken down!

Shockingly good burritos! I didn't have much expectation when I ordered their burrito instead of cheesesteaks because I am not a fan of them. I know... I haven't had a good experience with cheesesteaks in LA, so there. If you know a good cheesesteak in Los Angeles, send me a message.Where was I? Oh yes, burritos. It was packed with flavor and big enough for two people share. Winner in my book for late night greasy food. The food truck can be spotted on Fifth and Hill in Downtown LA in the evenings. Cash only, please! Nearest Metro Station: Red/Purple Lines at Pershing Square

The staff is super nice and friendly! We had breakfast and got the fruit waffle and the French crepe, with coffee (cappuccino and macchiato). The food was quite yummy. Fresh fruit on the waffle. We were visiting from out of town, but if we are ever back in the area, I would love to try their froyo. I was impressed with their variety of flavors,  a lot of the froyo flavors were ones I had not seen before. They had boba,  pastries, and sandwiches as well. All in all a lot of variety. Would definitely return if/when we are back in Anaheim!

We seemed to just miss the long line, stopping by around 11:30 AM on a Monday. The wait when we queued was about 30 min and I would do it again! Going with friends means someone can wander off and buy a beer or boba tea to share while the other held your place in line. My sister and I enjoyed The Slut- coddled egg over mashed potatoes in a mason jar and served with crusty baguette. I know what you're thinking- SO HIPSTER! You're right but man, is it so good! It was the perfect start to our culinary tour of the GCM.

Genwa is on the way to Koreatown which we liked. It's far enough to keep away from all the crowds and the horrible parking. The place itself has a really nice ambiance and clean. A lof of side dishes! No idea what they were. Tried them all, loved some, and could live life without some. Had one of the dinner courses that serves two and was more than enough! Bulgogi was perfect and the soup that was served with the meal, tofu I think, was delicious. The waiter we had was friendly, and checked up on us a lot to make sure we were ok and to answer any questions we had. Will be going back...

Best cheesesteak in LA. I first learned about Boo's through uber eats a few years ago and i've been hooked ever since. The classic, philly cheesesteak wit wiz is perfect and should be the first thing you try here! They ship their rolls in from philly, so you get an authentic flavor you don't get at other cheesesteak places in Los Angeles. They also serve pepper steaks and hoagies, but you might think of them as a side note, because the cheesesteak is so good.It's a gamble when you get the cheesesteaks delivered, because sometimes they show up cold and too greasy, but other times they're piping hot.

Sort of Japanese but also a motley mix of ingredients in every dish. Wasn't super hungry, so got the carrot dish (white carrots w dill cream sauces some jelly stuff and greenery) and chicken dumplings (that looked like a giant pancake) which were both outstanding.  They actually had Failla Pinot Noir on their menu which I've never seen before at a restaurant--- was incredible as I remember. Got 2 desserts: a smores-like ice cream sandwich, and some donuts with a molasses like honey sauce.  Sat at the bar since we were late walk ins - super nice bartender, food was great, and overall ambiance was an A.

This was an anthropologie like place but for food! Ambiance was excellent! The dining area and patio were full of spirit and energy! High ceilings, natural sun, and huge windows. We went for brunch and we were not disappointed! The tequila blackberry drink was on point, freshly made and just the right amount of tequila, gray fruit and blackberry! My boyfriend and I tried the sides and shared! They were amazingly delicious. We got the biscuits and gravy, bacon, and chicken and it was just enough for both of us! We will be back for dinner, cocktails, and a good time again! Definitely one of my favorite places!

Saw this on Yelp and went in for the first time on Sunday and was delighted! It was busy but we got greeted before we entered and seated promptly. Looks like a masculine diner with sports on the tv's and dark burgendy decor. The bathrooms are outside around the corner and clean. Menu was diner standard and we tried the famous omelets and french toast special. Food came out super fast and in huge portions! Both dishes were fluffy and fresh. As we were leaving the owner stopped by to chat and he packed us an iced coffee to go! Very friendly atmosphere and staff.

Oo-Kook Korean BBQ is a pretty awesome KBBQ spot. I would say it's now my second favorite in LA. We popped in one night because our favorite spot was closed, and Oo-Kook didn't have a wait. To our surprise the quality of the meats were great, at a decent price, and service was quick and on point. The only negative thing I can say about this place is that when they bring out the more expensive meats for example tongue  they give you less, than if you order something cheap like bulgoig. Not taking away a star because that is pretty common place in KBBQ spots. If our favorite place has a long wait, I'd gladly return to Oo-Kook.

Visiting LA for a few days and had a craving for some good Persian food. In the past, I would have gone to Raffi's Place in Glendale (perhaps the best Persian food in the US), but short on time decided to give it a shot. When we arrived, I was totally surprised by the casual order-at-the-counter ambiance, with high stools and IKEA looking tables --Persian cuisine is typically served at more upscale, white tablecloth establishments.  The food however did not disappoint. At. All. Persian food at its finest. Had the lamb kabob- tender, well-seasoned, and of course fluffy jasmine rice with hint of saffron. The staff was super friend as well. Highly recommend!!

Came here on two separate occasions. The first time I ordered char siu tsukemen. Although it was extremely tasty, I had wished the broth was much more hot. By the time I was half way done with my noodles I didn't even want to finish it because the broth was cold. The second time I ordered char siu tonkotsu and it was delicious.  The broth was nice and hot, and full of flavor. A tad bit salty, but nothing to really complain about (it could also be my own preference towards salt). Overall, the service here is fast, staff is extremely friendly, food is fresh and delicious.

Decided to make this a must when I was visiting a friend in LA. We went when they opened and were lucky to avoid the wait. Shortly after we ordered the long became really long. This brick and mortar has been opened for a while and it seems the hype still exists! And that's because the sandwiches are a quality breakfast staple. I got the sausage, egg & cheese and substituted the buttermilk biscuit for the brioche bun. Loved the honey mustard aioli. It's like a McDonalds Sausage McMuffin but gourmet (which means twice the price). Definitely come here for breakfast if you're not counting calories for the day.

Everything about this place was amazing. We went around 6pm for late lunch (traveling and still haven't quite adjusted to the time). I got the fried butter chicken sandwich (off menu) and my cousin got the Badmaash fried chicken, and we both had mango lassi to drink. All was INSANELY good, and by the time we sat down, ordered, got our drinks then food, and finished eating, it had only been 25-30 minutes. Our waiter was awesome and so was the food. Also the chili cheese naan was incredible. Wish I lived here so I could come all the time.

Their lunch combo was a steal, comes with a choice of ramen + appetizer + salad and if you check in, you get a free drink OR a free side! I've gotten the fatty pork and oh my, you don't even need to chew the pork, it melts right in your mouth! I can never have enough I'm telling you. Super tasty. The noodles were cooked just right where it's still chewy, but not hard or too soggy. Broth was rich and you can select your spice level. They have their own parking lot in front, but once it's full, you have to find street parking, and comes at 6pm, it'll be valet only.

We came here for a group lunch after a graduation. Our server was great about getting everyone started with some drinks and she made sure our drinks were never empty too. The vibe is really cool, and I loved the open air feel that it had.They have a nice typical selection of brew pub food. My husband and I actually both ended up ordering the extreme gulp burger and man they wern't kidding. The burger was massive and so full of flavor from all of the additions that come with it. I think it is a great value especially for the area. We would definitely come back.

I'm a huge fan of their rich, pork base soup. Their noodles are slightly more thicker and chewier than other ramen houses. I always put garlic, extra ginger, sesame seeds to make the soup even more flavorful. I love their medium boiled seasoned egg that comes with the ramen, and their tender chashu (thick cut pork belly). Don't get me started with their fried rice. They probably fry their rice in pork belly fat, which makes it so extremely mouth watering. Salad is great!!!! The only downside of this place is the long hours of waiting (unless you beat the wait and come at an odd time), and cash only. I despise cash only policies!

I live in Amsterdam and started planning my holiday to California over a year ago. As a real foodie I wanted to eat at the best places so Ray's Bbq came in the picture. I had a year of looking forward to it as pictures came by of spicemixes, midnight wrappings and 'sold-outposts'. Even after all my expectations building up it couldnt disappoint. Even with the great pictures bbq-fans share you cant imagine what this brisket tastes like! Pure perfection. His son (and the rest of the family) helped us out, a real enthousiast, and asked us if we had some good bbq places back in Europe. Nothing that even comes close to this. Thankyou for the awesome experience.

Came for lunch during opening special. Quality of the meat is great and there is ample veggies and noodle sides. Because the soup base is just plain water, the veggies and noodles do come out very bland unless you dip them all in sauce too. Lunch beef comes with 5 pieces (100g) which seems like very little but I was still full by the end of the meal. Only suggestion is to get a different brand of udon and noodles that retain the chewy noodle texture better when boiled for a long time. Otherwise great service and clean space. Would recommend!

I'm not sure what i was expecting, but this place blow my mind. I was debating between the French dip and a poutine, and hands down go poutine. I'm not a certified fry connoisseur, but am a definite fry snob and these fries were perfection.I got the country chicken fried steak, and it did not disappoint. The gravy and cheese curds were so good, and the biggest of chicken were tender and delicious. There were so many unique types of poutine that I'm looking for any reason to go back.A friend got the loco moco poutine, and said it was a great twist on loco moco. It definitely didn't tarnish the name sanctity of loco moco.

The restaurant that was here before got a huge upgrade in terms of food. The quality and taste is way better now and fresh. It takes 25 minutes for the Afghan lamb and chicken plate but well worth it. It was one of the best dishes I've tried. Especially from previous establishment in the same location the food is way better now. I gave it a 4 star because the management is the same old guy who doesn't know how to provide good service. Slow and arrogant demeanor. Other than that just be patient with him the food is worth it.

The food here is great, and almost every menu item is offered in a vegan version. The vegan menu includes tacos, taquitos, tamales, tortas, nachos, etc. I find the heavy usage of white beans a little weird, and I suggest they change this, but otherwise, everything I've had here has been really good. Stand out items are the soyrizo taquitos, churros, and frozato-vegan soft serve! Delicious. I don't understand all these hater reviews that negatively refer to Hugo's as white people Mexican food. Yeah, it's not traditional Mexican food. Is it bad Mexican food? No! It's delicious. If you want authentic Mexican food, go to a pinche taqueria-this is Los Angeles, they're on every corner.

If you are in a hurry, call in your order...Porto's is always packed and you have to wait for a table if you order in.  Don't let this discourage you because Porto's is awesome.  I wanted to pick up a fruit tart for a party and fortunately this was a short line with only 12 people ahead of me!  The line moved quickly and the counter help at Porto's are always super friendly and helpful.  I bought the 8 fruit tart and for $14 it is a steal.  The line for the potato balls and meat pies was just too long...oh well, an excuse to make another visit when I'm in Glendale :)

$1 street tacos?! AND $2 Horchata?! You cannot beat the prices here. And I know what you're thinking, $1 tacos? $2 horchata? Well it must not taste very good then. Sorry, you're wrong! Its AUTHENTIC and it's delicious! Meat choices: carne asada, al pastor, lengua, and cabeza. You walk up, say what type of tacos you want, how many you want, and then you pay the person (it's CASH ONLY btw). After that you walk over to their condiments. Fill up your tacos with salsa (it's pretty spicy), grilled onions, and then enjoy and bask in the greatness of the flavor on your tastebuds. This place is a gem, and it's a steal for the price!

The 5 star yelp review and my love of pizza is what got me driving all the way out to Sun Valley to give this place a go. The place does not disappoint even with  heightened expectations that come with having 5 stars on yelp. The pizza crust is just perfect. The flavors are creative and delicious. The service was amazing. The people who work there are passionate and take more time explaining the menu than the 1.5-2 minutes it takes to cook your pizza in a 786 degree oven shipped to the states from Naples. Stop reading reviews and get your butt over there.

Finally came here after years of Phillip L. Telling me how amazing this place was, and it truly lived up to all of the hype. We ordered the churro a with dulce de leche to share. Honestly, I've only really had Costco churros (and a few others that weren't all that notable), so I wasn't too sure how these could be that incredible.When they came, they were piled in a nice stack of 4 with beautifully caramel-colored dulce de leche drizzled across. Each churro was perfectly made, with a nice crisp and crunch, and the dulce de leche was the perfect accompaniment!I'll definitely be back next time I'm in LA!

I love this place, and there's really not much (if anything) to criticize. The Mozzarella sundriedTomato chicken wurst pairs well with a light kolsch. The elderflower soda is an unexpected but delightful non-alcoholic drink. You must get the fries, hands down, no matter what. They're thick cut and very crisp. And in terms of dipping sauces, the curry ketchup and pesto mayo are my favorites. I also highly recommend the hot link.   The space is pretty big and I've never had trouble finding a table. Make sure you try ALL of the mustards as they are all special and delicious in their own way.

First time trying Howlin' Ray's and it lived up to the hype!I tried The Sando (Mild) - really good flavors overall and a nice kick of spice! The fried chicken was juicy and pretty big in portion size for a sandwich. I guess that's expected since they use a chicken breast though! The slaw, sauce, pickles and bread were a perfect complement to it. I also tried the Shake Fries - pretty good too and well seasoned! The only downside - I felt pretty heavy after devouring The Sando and it got pretty messy while eating it (probably used 3-4 napkins at least). With that being said, I would definitely eat here again and I would highly recommend for everyone!

3 stars for the food, 1 extra for the ambience. It feels like you are truly in a bustling, French eatery! The wait was an hour but I certainly did not mind staring at the all the delicious desserts in the bakery in the front. It' s $2 per macaron and I got once of each of the 13 flavors!I can't wait to come back here to drink mimosas! I ordered the melon juice, eggs benedict, and the Portobello fries... was good but lacked flavor. The pepperoni pizza and italian scramble were just eh. The service was very good and the place is beautiful! Found lot parking for $5!

What a gem - this is the best sul lung tang I've ever had (and I've had a good number before already)! Very cheap for AMAZING soup!The sul lung tang broth is incredibly fragrant and you can tell it's been cooked forever. You get a good amount of meat inside and the meat is incredibly tender and soft. I love their side dishes of kimchi and radish (the radish is my fav!). The soup came out within 5-10 min of us ordering, which is super quick.Absolutely perfect on a cold day! Worth every single $, and I will def be coming back next time I'm in LA!

Wanted to try the pineapple Agua Fresca but they didn't have it and I had a hard time deciding what to get. The lady gave me sample of the flavors: watermelon, mango passion fruit, and pink lemonade. Mango passion fruit and pink lemonade was sooooo good and refreshing. I ended up getting the mango passion fruit.Got the calamari, asada, and al pastor taco.All were good but the calamari was really the bomb!! Will definitely get the calamari next time!! Tortilla were soft and delicious.  Wanted a burrito and somebody had recommended the chicharron burrito.Very tasty but Chicharron was kinda tough, but it is pork belly so.... yeah.

While on the cation part of my left coast trip I was able to convince my friend Toshi to meet me here for a late lunch. I've of course been here before and had fond memories of the food and last left coast visit in general. La Pergoletta did not disappoint. It was still cozy and inviting, and the food was still fantastic. Went with the burrata salad and lasagna special (pic thanks to big T).  Both were great and really hit the spot. For dessert it was the fruit panna cotta, which I wish I could have at every meal. If only this place was on the east coast or anywhere close to Langley Falls.

I've been back many times now and they've added so many new things to the menu. Everything I try is above what I expect it will be. The sandwiches are big and so tasty! The cookies (choc chip and oatmeal raisin) are so decadent. I love every drink I've had. They even have kombucha now which I'd like to try. Again, I'm so glad they moved into the neighborhood. They even took my previous advice and added art to the walls. My only other suggestion would be a frequent customer drink card because I'm one and you should be too!

So this really isn't a biergarten so don't come in expecting that.They do have a pretty good selection of beers and food.We ordered several things off the menu (chicken, short rib grilled cheese, fries) and were pleased with the quantity and quality.The best thing about this place, though, is the freaking size of their steins. I would estimate that it's over 30 oz and pretty difficult to hold steadily with 1 hand when full. If for nothing else, you have to come try this. yelp.com/biz_photos/xJT5 Would probably recommend taking a taxi here, as I can't imagine too many people being able to drive after drinking a couple of these big boys.

I tried this place and immediately told myself I would be coming back...but in an uber since I don't live far from DTLA. The food is amazing here and I tried their black sheep burger and it was flavorful at every single bite. It's not a really big place, kinda small but the quality of the food is insane...so good! The reason I give it 4 stars though is because of the parking. You have to pay like $10-20 on a lot and walk a block or so. I can't stand businesses that don't have a parking area. Anyway aside from that the food is great! It's a must try!

Great little diner.  Went there for lunch, on a weekday.  So we missed out being able to try some of their weekend brunch items.  But that was fine, as we enjoyed the cinnamon sugar coated brioche (with strawberry compote) and the leeks with egg and cheese.  It was absolutely delicious (and worth working out a bit longer for the extra calories).  The service was very good.  The waiter was attentive and friendly.  Being stuffed, we took one of each of their doughnuts to go (to share).  Loved the maple bacon and the red velvet.  Liked the strawberry. and didn't care for the 2 others.

My husband and I stopped by today for the first time and loved our meal. I had the fish and frites and he had the shepherds pie. Both were delicious. His stout and my wine did not disappoint either. Both were well described by our server. While the food and drinks should be enough, we also would recommend eating here for the ambiance and service. Though this place is clearly modern and hip it has a relaxed and comfortable feel to it and the servers were friendly, helpful and very good at what they do. We look forward to our next visit!

One of my absolute favorite places to go grab a quick & healthy lunch downtown! I LOVE the fact that they have gluten free bread, not many places do. My go to is the avocado toast with the gluten free millet bread with an egg on top, so delicious. I always grab an iced americano or cold brew to go with it. The coconut date balls are such a light & healthy dessert/snack and so tasty! There's generally street parking around them. Very good customer service every time I go in, and they're pretty quick with the food! Love love love this place

Aesthetic space and desserts! and macarons!!I've been blessed to have tried the various macaron flavors :) My favorites were the -- - Grand Cru (intense dark chocolate) &- Earl Grey (the most special-looking macaron, blue with gold flecks, interesting subtle flavor!).There's a lot of colorful choices for everyone's tastes, but  hopefully these help! For fruity flavors, I'd recommend Strawberry over Mango, as strawberry had a fresher taste, while the mango flavor was weak and more of a fragrance. For floral, Rose over Violet Cassis, as Rose had a more pleasant flavor than just a light fragrance like violet.Overall, love the crisp outside texture, soft chewy inside.

I would have given this 5 stars, but the young lady who greeted us when we arrived seemed bothered that we made her do work and by work I mean show us where our table is. Aside from her stank facial expressions the food here was delicious!Our server was awesome! He was super friendly and jovial. My table ordered some burgers and they all were in heaven. I had the Mac and Cheese with pulled pork and it was yummy! The Haystack was aaaaaamazing! The Mai Tais were mighty strong, but great for $5 bucks! I definitely plan on returning.

I've been coming here for a really long time, and every time I feel like a little kid in a candy store. It puts a smile on my face when I come in, and see all the colors and shapes of the desserts so perfectly accommodated. I thought of writing this review just to suggest about offering a curbside service in the near future.Other than that the food is really good, the club sandwich is really tasty, also the pizza and the portobello fries are a very creative way to cut some calories that actually taste amazing. Love the new macaron flavors, PB&J and Birthday Cake YUMMMM!

Here's a Hidden Gem in Korea town. I get their BBQ chicken & all you can eat Banchan (side dishes) lunch special for $10! Plus their complimentary brown rice water :-) What a steal! . Parking is a pain during lunch time so I usually come around 11am so as not to pay the $2 parking or after 1:30pm to avoid lunch rush AND avoid paying $2 parking :-) My rating is for the food and service. Not into giving or deducting stars for parking or how long it took to get the food. I think it's silly to dock stars for frivolous things like that

I'm not a huge fan of baked foods, but Porto's Bakery certainly is an eye opener to how good baked goods really can be.I had the guava & cheese strudel and the cheese roll.The cheese roll is very, very cheesy so if you don't really like your sweets, make sure to stay away from this one.The guava & cheese strudel tastes much better than the cheese roll as it is more flakey and not as cheesy. The extra guava flavor helps balance the cheesiness. I think if I were to go back, I'd like to try the guava strudel. The strudels here are simply amazing and the guava flavor is unique.

Very intimate setting & a small restaurant.  We were greeted warmly to our table & served in the sweetest manner.  The food was good! I had the Pad Thai version & I really liked it.  The boys had the Boat Noodle Soup & the Beef Noodle soup & they all raved about it.  We ate on a weeknight so we pretty much had the restaurant to ourselves & had no problem with parking.  During high times, I can absolutely see it getting crowded as the seating is very limited.  But it's such a cute restaurant in Cambodia Town of Long Beach & I'm more than happy to patronize it & recommend others to give it a try.

Marugame Monzo puts crack into their udon. I swear they do, even thought, they make their udon at the store, I'm sure they sprinkle some before they serve it to you.With that being said, just be prepared for 1 hour wait. The staff is very attentive and diligent. The food is so good. I love glutenous noodles and Marugame just delivers. It's very different from all the numerous ramen bars in Little Tokyo. The soup they serve with their udon is slightly salty ---that umami, mouthwatering experience. So far, I've tried the mushroom udon and the cold udon. I didn't like the cold udon as much.

I love this location, it's so unique and definitely better than the other locations I've been to. It has plenty of places to sit inside or outside the establishment. Out of everything I've ordered here, not one thing disappointed including the service. The only thing that was an issue was the parking but I was lucky to find a spot near the postal office that was paid for already. Great place to enjoy your coffee while people watching or doing some work. Anytime I'm in need of some caffeine and in the area, I will indeed make a pit stop here.

This outdoor cafe is a short walk into Griffith Park on Fern Dell Drive (near the Western Avenue entrance).  It's a great pit stop before and/or after a walk or hike.  I've only been here in the morning and so far I've enjoyed their CHEDDAR AND CHIVE SCONE and SAGE BLUE CORNBREAD.  Both are fantastic (I love the use of herbs), on the dense side and best while they're still warm.The CAPPUCCINO and STRAWBERRY LEMONADE were also quite good, but my friend thought her regular coffee was just so-so.Picnic table seating.  Bring your family, friends, kids and dogs!

What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said. I came in from out of town and knew i had to stop here. I went at 2pm so thankfully wasn't too crowded. I got the mike in the morning dog and a polish pastrami dog, both were amazing, the polish was super thick and big, and the dog came with chili cheese and fries on top, it was so filling and good, one of the best meals i had in LA, on par if not better than all the chicago hot dog joints, i cant recommend enough

Parking can be a nightmare because of the popularity. If the lot is full, don't be afraid to park that baby on the sidewalk (hopefully there's room). They have their breakfast menu up until 11:30 AM, so get that parking and save a seat.Minced Beef Congee ($6.95)Nice big portion that comes with a surprising amount of meat. Nice and hot; perfect for a colder day and in the morning. On top of this warm goodness, you get a choice between fried noodles or a steamed bun. All this food for $7? Down.My one knock is the servers are a little I-don't-really-care, especially if you don't speak Cantonese.

Valet parking. Their waiting area is great and they set up heat lamps for waiting guests. Beautiful seating and service is impeccable. Before you can ask for water the staff is there refilling your cup. The waiter apologized up front before we ordered saying the kitchen was backed up. Very thoughtful and makes you ok with waiting extra. The food came out and it was delicious. Portions are large, one plate enough for 2 people. The filet mingon was cooked perfectly, the meat so tender it  melted like butter. Everything is delicious, and such simple ingredients stand out because they are cooked perfectly. Would highly recommend.

This place is so bomb. We had the combo deal, which was the spicy Galbi jjim + a soup + a beverage for about 50 bucks? The Galbi was the small size, which was pretty damn huge. Didn't actually see anyone ordering the large. The beef was so soft and flavorful!! It also comes with onions, carrots, potatoes, and rice cake. Really good if you also like spicy. We took about half of it home with us. The soup was amazing as well. Flavorful with lots of vegetables and meat. Banchan was also excellent (esp the kimchi). They also said we could have soju, soda, or beer. We chose the beer. Seriously a good deal for so much food and deliciousness.

I had the filet mignon & chicken breast kabob with sauteed spinache & mashed potatoes.Chicken breast was cooked perfectly. Moist, tender and good flavor as it should be. It's easy to over cook chicken breast to were it's dry and tuff but that wasn't the case here. I called a day in advance to make a reservation for Mothers Day. Thanks to Hye Cuisine for making it a great dinner for me and my party of 14. Everyone enjoyed their meal and their dining experience.By the way, I've used their delivery service which is very convenient and their food product is equally as good as dining in.

How have I never heard of Tsukemen? It is easy to get a seat for one or two but plan on waiting if you have more in your party as this is one of THE spots in Japan Town. The restaurant is conveniently located, just pay attention to parking signs and tines since parking enforcement is in full force. I really enjoyed the Tsukemen with egg and cha su. Agree it's on the saltier side but that's typical for ramen dishes. I liked how the noodles are thicker and chewy. It's a nice spin to a ramen dish and will definitely be ordering this from other places now that I know what it is!

Great place to dine before events at Disney Hall.  The staff will make sure you can dine leisurely in style,  with as many courses you choose, and still get you to your performance on time, which is just steps away.  That said, I recommend you allow 2.5-3hrs for the experience so as not to be rushed.  Dining here is an experience!We had the seven course tasting menu -- highly recommend along with the wine pairing.  Each dish is a work of art and is incredibly delicious.  The service is 5 star  plus, from the moment you walk in the door until you pay your bill.   Kudos to management and the staff for a great culinary experience.

I always order the Veggie Ramen $10.00 (made with Vegan Noodles), generous portion size and it never disappoints! So good! This restaurant is always busy so expect a wait, typically 20 mins. to be seated but definitely worth it. It's a clean small busy place with great food. They offer a free topping with a Facebook or Yelp Check-In (I always get an egg... DELICIOUS!)Cons: -Restaurant atmosphere is loud-Seating is at a high community table-Parking is located in the plaza and is terrible. Valet only and it's always full so it's best to just look for street parking but warning: surrounding residential area is sketchy at night. Best to just Uber.

Que Bella! Fantastico! What can I say, everything is delicious & as authentic as it can get. I ordered fettuccine and then you can take the other dish home ( for those not into the massive serving sizes they give out nowadays) & I'd say great prices for so much food, as well as yummy.The restaurant is super cute and has the typical Italiano decor. Cute, a little romance but you could totally relax and enjoy your meal because it's super spacious.The waiters, well majority were male (we got a cute one) or that's just all I noticed. They were all very attentive, respectful, and we're very good at what they do. Serving you! So, 5 stars guys!!!

This here is a cute hole in the wall Indonesian/Singaporean restaurant. Pasadena is full of hidden gems like these so if you're here and/or reading this review, great job!I tried the Singapore Laksa and was thoroughly pleased with it. They use two different noodles in the soup so don't be alarmed when you suddenly see thin noodles appear. I'm no expert on Singaporean cuisine but this seemed to be a nice introduction to it! Parking is mostly limited to street parking but it should be manageable if there aren't a whole lot of PCC students out and about.

Came here for late night dinner after LA Korean Festival.  There's a mobile check in which would be very beneficial here as it's a busy ramen place.  Ramen was awesome, had the non-spicy and was just perfect.  Chicken for me was nicely cooked and seasoned, mushrooms were shiitake and only .50 extra.  Base broth is pork, they have a vegetarian option however.  Small was perfectly sized and well worth more than the 9 bucks it is.  Honestly would totally come back here when in the area.  Literally the only reason this isn't 5 stars is because it would be beneficial to have more options for broths beside just veggie and pork.

My third time here. First two times had the obligatory #7, and was not disappointed. Literally just blocks from both the Police Academy and Fire training facility explains the high percentage of officers and firemen. This time, I met with a friend, and we ordered the #6, Pastrami sandwich. Being St. Paddy's day, she insisted Pastrami is the Italian Corned Beef, right? I had the regular one with the marinara, she had hers without the sauce and with mustard and a pickle. Mine was great, and hers looked just as good. I will be back, and perhaps try the sausage and meatball. Although, I hear the pasta is very good too, and then there is the eggplant ...

What to get here...Fried calamariFried fish Fish Tacos Softshell crab Sliders And their HH oysters!They have late night HH too which is great!Park in the same building and you can self park downstairs. Just tell the valet guy you want to self park.Take the elevator up, make a right then left towards the market and another left away from the market and its in the right side. This is the back entrance so walk towards the front.They show odd videos...last time it was some animal channel where a beat ate a wolf...really made my appetite curl. :/

Soooo good! Seriously! Everything is so fresh and delicious.My fianc  and I first tried Taste of Tehran a week and a half ago. It was so good, we ordered delivery about two days ago. Yesterday we are there for lunch!! I'm dreaming about it now...I'm a pescetarian so I get the Salmon Kabob with the eggplant dip to start. Just like the other reviews say, the eggplant dip is incredible. So full of flavor.My fianc  has tried something different each time and loved them all. He even loves the salad, which he normally doesn't eat.We will keep going back for me!

Loved this place, its soo cute and homey and has a paris theme to it. ordered and then we sat in their patio and had our dessert. place is very clean, bathroom is very clean and the service is very nice. Crepes were awesome, we had the banana, nutella and strawberry  one and it was delicious Nutella wasn't enough so I asked for a side of it and I was charged. I know it might be a big deal but the nutella on the crepe wasn't enough for the size of it.a $1.50 for a side was a bit excessive but it is what it is.

Excellent!! First time we dined here was for our anniversary.  Waitress was awesome, they gave us complimentary champagne in celebration and food was amazing, We were so full on the best Caesar salad ever and Tahitian poke that by the time the entrees came we were stuffed,  2nd time here we dropped in after a romantic walk on the beach and was able to get a seat at the bar for two. Caesar salad did not disappoint and we had yummy penne pasta.  Thank you Dominique's for anniversary coupons and the generous family that bought us a round when we moved from bar to table!

3 tacos + drink combo 4/5 * @ixtacotaqueria * I already reviewed this place, but it deserves another since they changed up the tortilla. This is still my favorite taco spot right down the street, perfect for a quick taco run. Their tortillas are one of the biggest sellers for me because they have that delicious hand-pressed, homemade flavor that you can't get at the store. If you come, you gotta try all the different meats and options they have to offer. Last time they didn't have blue corn tortillas, but this time they did. I wonder if they're transitioning to blue corn now?

I love the interior and the quaintness of this place.Probably one of my favorite brunch places!There can also be a longgg wait, but it depends what day/time you go. Try to avoid peak meal times and go earlier if you can.The food is a little on the pricier end, but definitely worth it. The Crunchy French Toast is SO GOOOD!! We also tried a Pesto Chicken Sandwich, but the french toast was my favorite.Overall, good service, friendly workers, and good food! The only thing that sucks is finding street parking, but that's expected in LA. Would definitely recommend this place!

Two $$?!?!More like half a $...or maybe just an S.Despite being the size of my bedroom, this place is my little island of Capri in the middle of Ktown, and the price is so right.  Both times I've been here, I've split a pizza and pasta dish of sorts.  Both were great.  And the bill is a whopping $19.58.None of the food (that I've had so far) has been a spectacular mouthplosion, but it's just solid corner shop Italian cuisine.  I was really lacking a neighborhood pizza place, too.They make the pizza right in front of you.  Seriously, they almost throw that shit is your face.  It's like Harry Potter closet in there.

New restaurant in town.  It seems like this place is opening at many other cities as well.  This restaurant is very popular in Korea.  Since they recently opened, customer service was excellent, and very clean.  Since I stop by at 5PM, I didn't have to wait..  Normally there are very long waiting list.  I loved their open kitchen.  I guess this is trend these days.  Seeing how my food is made me felt that I can trust the food.  Due to lack of time, I had a simple sprout with brisket food but will definitely come again to try out their combo meal.

The fried fish tacos here are the best! The fish is generous and lightly breaded. What makes the fish taco different from other places is that the fried coat on the fish is more like a breaded panko and not like a beer batter. The salsa comes with chopped jalapenos so it can get spicy with the chipotle sauce that goes on top. Tip: Get the sauce on the side if you dont like spicy... or MORE sauce if u do ;) The pork was very flavorful and a little too salty and sweet for my preference but my friend really enjoyed it. Cant wait to try more items!

You honestly can't go wrong with ANYTHING you order here.$11.95 for a giant bowl of hearty goodness. Whether you're feeling under the weather, hungover, cold, or simply craving MSG (kidding), the soup here will leave you feeling 10 years younger. My parents and I all got the Seafood Kalgooksoo, and it was delightful. I wish there were more slices of pumpkin inside, because it was so good! The noodles are so thick and chunky and have a homemade texture to them, like the ones my grandpa makes. Parking here SUCKS, but do valet parking or $2 because no matter how crowded the lot looks, they'll find a place to cram you in.

Love this place for breakfast!!! I came here with a group of friends. We all had different things that were all amazing in flavor. My hangover eggs hit the spot. I am not a pancake person but I tried my friend'a pancakes and they were delicious. My other friend had chilaquiles which she said were great. We got a bacon doughnut to go and it was just as good. Mimosa was good too. I can't wait to go back since the breakfast is so good there is a long wait but it is well worth it. Parking was easy to find on a Sunday morning. Service is good too. The host guy was great.

First off, pizza here is legit! They have Calabrian chile oil to dip your crust in.  The salads are delicious too! They have wonderful gelato and Canolis for dessert. They have tons of great beer & wine choices! The atmosphere is super casual. You order at a register, pay, then look for a seat at their long communal tables. This location is very clean, has a lot of character and the self parking lot is a plus in this neighborhood! They make their own dough here and they have four separate almond wood burning pizza ovens that you can watch them make the pizza in.  They also have tasty calzones. I highly recommend this spot

I was feeling lazy to cook lunch on a Saturday. Decided to check this place that we've noticed when we passed by Temple St. On our way home. I ordered bbq pork with spicy eggplant salad and french fries. Hubby ordered the beef tri tip with coleslaw. The servings were large, I had to ask hubby to finish my food. The eggplant salad looks like mashed eggplant, but the taste was awesome. The bbq pork was juicy and tasty. French fries are made from real potatoes. Sodas are refillable.  The place is cool and clean. I only gave 4 stars because they don't have paper towels and hand dryer in the restroom.

A trendy churrasco spot in Ktown.  One of my more favored places than Fogo since it is a bit closer.  Service is always great.My favorite cut is the picanha.  (regular, garlic, and parmesan).  I like the garlic the best.  Top and bottom sirloin was also tender and juicy that night.  Although I'm usually an avid lamb lover, lamb that night was a tad bit dry.  I was also disappointed with the choices as there weren't much to choose from (or maybe we kept getting passed)Overall, I had a fantastic dinner and a great catchup with my friend.  Definitely a place I revisit often.

Wow! We had a great evening! Service was top notch. I have to emphasize..top notch! We were hosting an out of town guest & it was late..thanks to Yelp we found Bestia. It was Friday at 9:30pm & I was able to make a 10:30pm reservation via OpenTable. Lamb neck sounds yucky, but hubby loves lamb. Fortunately, he ordered the last piece & he was in food heaven. We all shared a salad, pizza & dessert. Everything was great.It's a younger crowd. Our guest felt the music was a bit loud, so we dined outside on the patio. It was a lovely evening. To Bestia management..you have an awesome staff!

If you want delicious quality seafood this is THE place. Everything here was very fresh!My favorites are the uni pasta, uni sashimi, fresh oysters, steak, and their sausage fried rice! COD always has a large selection of wine and whiskey. The service here has always been very good, friendly waiters. Not only that the downstairs of the restaurant has good ambience, their upstairs also has a balcony where you can enjoy some fresh air and people watch. I have been here many times and never got sick of the place. This is one of my favorite spots in LA.

Pizza is one of my FAVORITE foods and village pizzeria does it right! They have thick and thin crust. I like thin crust because a girls gotta watch her waistline and personally I like thin dough better because I don't like the dough to overpower the taste of the cheese and toppings.Well obviously the crowd pleaser is the clam and garlic which me and my friend got. We got half clam and garlic and half pollo which consists of chicken breast tomatoes and cilantra. I liked the clam and garlic better than the pollo( not that the pollo wasn't delicious as well) . I want to try the other toppings next time. CANT WAIT!

I was in town visiting a friend and had some time to kill while he was at work. I was curious what a British pub in LA would be like, so I popped in for their happy hour for some chips and a beer. I was ELATED to see they had Boddingtons on tap (and a brief convo with the fellow on the next bar stool over supported my theory that it was indeed uncommon, even in LA). The basket of chips was delicious and a steal during happy hour. The bartender was quick and her accent (I'm assuming Nottingham area) was delightful. Can't wait to go back.

My second time at Aloha Cafe and I don't know why I don't come here more often! The saimin is super legit! The noodles and broth tastes just like Hawaii. If you don't know what saimin is it is a noodle soup from Hawaii that came about during the old plantation days where immigrant workers from around the world ate together and threw different things in the pot. It has kamaboko, char siu and veggies,  I got mine wirh won ton. It comes with hot mustard on the side.  The corned beef hash was also ono! Everything is good here, the best Loco Moco also.

Pink's, iconic Los Angeles Hot Dog Restaurant that offers a wide variety of tasty mouth watering hot dogs and hamburgers.  On this visit I ordered their speciality burrito 3 Dog Night, 3 Hoffy hot dogs, 3 strips of bacon, and three slices of Swiss cheese, chilis, onions all wrapped up in a large flour tortilla, I had them add sauerkraut for added flavor. A very satisfying meal.I washed down my meal with a bottle of Dr. Pepper and I was happy camper. Pink's accepts both cash and credit cards, so if you love hot dogs, great burgers, and tasty chili, stop at Pink's, you'll be glad you did.

Came here on Christmas and ordered the Crispy Pork, Chinese Broccoli over steamed rice. I also ordered the spicy sour soup with extra seafood. Wow huge chunks of seafood and the soup was delicious. I truly enjoyed my dish and i forgot to mention that i added a fried egg. I originally was going to eat there but again it was Christmas and I found that my order was taking longer than the others who came after me and ate before me. Since I had to be somewhere I took it to go. My friend and I both loved it and I will be returning again. Thank you for the hospitality and being open.

I've never met a sweet crepe that I didn't love. I had the $1.50 nutella crepe special because it was national nutella day. woohoo! So yummy with a scoop of ice cream.My phone wouldn't let me check-in, it kept saying I was too far. I always have this problem on my phone when trying to check into a food truck.There is a check-in special (free scoop of ice cream) so I was getting kind of bummed, but she let me have it when i showed her my phone.I hope I can try savory crepes as well the next time I see them!

This place was amazing! I ordered their chicken pesto panini with a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice. The wait staff was super friendly and helpful. A lady pointed me towards the pictures and helped me order. I was seated almost immediately upon ordering. Their fresh squeezed orange juice was simply delish. (Duh fresh squeezed)Their chicken pesto panini was awesome. The bread was perfect, toasty on the outside and soft on the inside. Their pesto was great, it wasn't to oily or dripping down the side. The chicken was cooked nicely and the tomato and fresh greens tied it all together!

Oh my! This place was so delicious. I came here with some friends on a Saturday night and there was zero wait. The eight of us shared two orders of Gamjatang and our own side of rice. I was in soup heaven. It's definitely better than any bone soup I've had before. The flavors are ridiculous and I salivate just thinking about it! The pork falls right off the bones.The ban chans are delicious too. Fish cakes are my favorite. The only downside is the parking situation. It's valet, but can get full if you come too late. But still...I can't wait to come back!

Love love luv2eat can't go wrong with a place that one of my favorite chefs has been to. David Chang knows his food. That's how we found this gem from his IG post. We got the steak larb & sticky rice to share. I ordered the jade noodles with 3 bbq and my S/O ordered the pad Thai. We both got some Thai tea for our drinks. The service was great and had no problem getting a table even with us arriving 30 minutes before closing. They also prepare the dishes to your preferred spice level. Highly recommend if you are in the area and want some authentic Thai food. Will definitely be returning when we're in town.

This is the only Somali restaurant I've seen in LA. It's not a sit-down-and-order restaurant, although there are about a dozen four-person tables in a reasonably neat dining room. You order from the menu at the entrance and they bring you your food as it's ready. I started it's the savory soup, which is a chicken stock with large vegetable chunks - potatoes, carrots, and celery - and cabbage. Delicious!I also had the goat with rice, which comes garnishes with a small salad and traditional banana. Goat is their specialty, and it's a mammoth platter with lot of vegetables fried up together. Well seasoned with rich earthy flavors, and potatoes on the rice, a nice authentic touch!

Yeah, to Cuban food!! First timer and I enjoyed it. Got the Versailles special with rice and beans. Their portions are huge, you basically get half a chicken and a mound of rice. I particularly enjoyed the onions with the chicken for some reason, I just thought they went well. The chicken had too much of a citrus taste and it was just a bit dry. The sangria was a little weak and they served it in a weird pitcher, it didn't seem like it would hold a lot of liquid but it surprised me.Overall this place is good. Good ambiance, place was packed and it had pics of celebs on the walls, the service was prompt and friendly.

I love okonomiyaki, so when I found this place I was sooo happy. I got the Ika Ika (squid) okonomiyaki with traditional noodles. It was so good! The noodles were thick and chewy. The squid was a bit over cooked but I didn't mind. The pancake and other fillings just worked so well with the entire dish. They also cut it up in pieces for you. Oh and you must use the sauces they have on the table - the Japanese mayo and some sweet sauce. They go perfectly with the dish!! I would definitely come back and try the crispy noodle version and the signature chinchinkurin okonomiyaki.

We ordered Budae Jjigae its a big pot of soup thats is similar to kimchi soup but this comes with spam, ramen, and sausage.  Its enough to feed 2-3 people and you eat it with rice.  I personally like to save room towards the end for them to make fried rice for you using the soup.  Its extra $2 if I remember it correctly.  The soup was very good and the side dishes were good.  One bad thing about anything place in LA is parking.  Hard to find parking.  Even if there is spot people seriously doesnt know how to park so theyll take up two spots easily.

I came here with my girlfriend as we were looking to just try someplace new. I must say the menu had a good number of items to try and everything sounded delicious. We ordered several plates and all of them were delicious. The Key Lime pie had a graham cracker crust that was excellent and the fried pork belly was new for me, but I'll be back for it again! I'm a fry guy and I have to be honest... I'll probably come back just for the fries lol.It was a busy night so the service could've been a touch better, but aside from that it was great!

Friend took me here while I was visiting LA and showed me the ropes to eating the noodles. It was delicious! I loved mine with the egg. They give you so many noodles that I couldn't even finish so you know their portions are right on! This was super delicious and worth coming to...come here if you're in the area! The place seems really popular so be prepared to wait. I came on a Thursday during lunch and we didn't have to wait since there was only 2 of us but I for sure saw other people waiting. Didn't seem to take too long to get them seated though. Pro tip: Cash only! Be prepared!

I'm not a vegan, but I ordered a camarones al ajillo and it was really good. The rice had a really nice tomato-y flavor, but in a good way - and the camarones were pretty tasty despite not being real shrimp. AND THOSE FLATTENED PLANTAINS. make sure you get some, they are fried and delicious.We went when there wasn't a lot of people, and the outside courtyard was really relaxing and pretty.The reason why I gave five stars is because of the outstanding service, though. The servers are nice, and the owner is very nice to talk to. He treated us to some melon soda after a chat!! I had never tasted melon soda before, but it was great!!

If there is a bon chon heaven, then this place is it. After ordering, we were delivered not 10, 15, or 20 bon chon, but 23! Yes, that's right. 23 bon chon. Where do you even start? Favorites were the jelly fish, sprouts, radish, and boiled peanuts! I You heard that right--boiled peanuts.Our course served the four of us perfectly. For $169 we received multiple cuts of beef and pork  along with a bottle soju, bibimbap, and soup. For the quality and the service and the plethora of bon chon it's really not a bad deal.Line them up...the bon chon that is!

Cute little hidden gem near the flower mart in downtown Los Angeles. Parking is tricky but it's worth it when you find a spot. Walk in, very homey decor and chill place to grab breakfast or lunch. Biscuit and gravy-fluffy buttery biscuits, smothered in delicious gravy and topped with your choice of how you want your eggs cooked. Chicken and waffle-I like to eat this separately. Like to enjoy my salty before I dig into my sweets! Chicken lightly battered and fried. Super duper juicy and delicious. Waffle fluffy and soft. I do like my waffles a little crunchy, I'll ask them to over cook it next time. Hands down everything we ordered it was delicious! Service was very good.

Their Galbijim works up to its hype, but I'd say it's definitely on the pricey side. Go there either earlier or later, but because the space inside is not much, the line tends to be long and takes a while - though their turnover rate is quite fast. We got the large galbijim, medium spice, and the sullungtang (they said the galbijim alone is not enough). However, we still had a bunch of leftovers so I'd say a large is enough to feel 4-5 people for sure. Their kimchi is amazing so we had quite a few servings of those. Give it a try, you won't regret it :)

The guy working the register is a hoot. He makes the whole experience, IMO.The 4 stars is only for the eggs benedict. Everything else here is just so-so. Don't get the steak burrito - it is COMPLETELY tasteless and a waste of your time and appetite. The pulled pork hash was good, but nothing stellar. If this place didn't have the eggs benedict, I would probably give Poppy + Rose 2.5 stars.Oh! AND TIP!!! Instagram your meals!!! And then tag Poppy+Rose. If they like your photo, and repost it, they'll send you a $10 gift card for your next meal, along with a super cute thank you note! LOVE that about this restaurant. Great marketing strategy.

I have been coming here for a while for their fish taco deal, it is $1 on Wednesday only. The first time I came here the fish was huge and the taste was terrific. It goes good with their green sauce and lemon. After a while the fish gotten a little bit smaller but the flavor is still there, which include the cilantro, cabbage, and a bit of their red sauce. The parking lot here is small, I usually park on the street. This place is small with a small dining room in the inside, which has only three table. They also have a patio outside where you can eat as well.

Went here for the first time today because I saw a sign on the street saying  tofu donuts the other day and I am hooked now! The donuts are fluffy, flavorful, and my new favorite breakfast option. The service was excellent. I felt welcomed and comfortable. The atmosphere in there is tasteful and the aroma is heavenly. I got the iced salted coffee and my girlfriend got the salted hot chocolate. The hot chocolate is high quality and not overly sugary. We also got one of every donut. The fig so far is my favorite. Perfect place! 5 stars all the way around.

Oh my yummms! We popped in on a Saturday morning for a pastry and a coffee, and we weren't the only ones with that idea. The line was out the door and almost around the corner! Pro tip: you are able to order pastries and coffee or to-go orders from the coffee window on the side and skip the line, so we did just that! I got a mochi tea and raspberry pastry with almonds, and it was flavorful and cake like and very delicious. I'd love to be back someday to sit down inside - the building is supposedly very historic.

What a beautifully built and decorated restaurant! The ambiance can't be beat from the lighting to the decor to the music. From the moment you walk in, the staff treats you like royalty. While a bit pricey, the dinner selection is delicious. I had the lobster bisque to start and then the filet. The meal was perfect. My friend ordered the tenderloin and spatzle which was very yummy as well. The portions are generous, plated nicely, and over all worth the money. Be sure to order one of their seasonal craft cocktails. p..s. I hear the chocolate souffle is amazing. Must try it next time!

Stumbled upon this place and so glad we did! I had dinner with a Texas native, & as soon as he took a bite of those ribs...he gave the Texas stamp of approval. Can't get any more legit than that! Our waitress Claudia was very helpful explaining the menu to us Maple Block virgins. She helped us decide what compliments well with our choice of meat, from the biscuits to the red wine. And of course, we had to finish the meal off with some banana pudding - which is a must! This establishment not only has great food, but the atmosphere & customer service is what got this place their 5 stars from me! I will definitely be coming back.

I don't know where to start. I was just passing though and saw a long line and a lot of noise so I decided to investigate a little bit more. And I am so glad I did. The wait wasn't as bad as I anticipated. Made it through in about 50 minutes and had my food at about the 1 hour mark. I ordered the medium spicy chicken sandwich and it was amazing. Just the right level of spicy and flavor. The staff were awesome. Made the 1 hour wait for a chicken sandwich way worth it. Very interactive and genuinely good and fun people. Don't forget to try the sweet peach tea. I can't get enough of it.

We came for lunch today and upon arrival, we noticed a large amount of people waiting oustide. Doh! It was about a 45min wait. But once we were seated, our order was taken fairly quickly and our food arrived just as quick. Waitress was very nice. Sashimi Lunch for $15, you can't beat that! And it's presented so beautifully as well. I only wish we knew what was what. Surprisingly, no salmon sashimi included. I ordered the salmon teriyaki & sashimi combo (yelp.com/user_local_phot ) and pretty much cleared my plate. Then again, I love all things salmon..It's a fairly small place and it being so popular, do expect a wait or come as early as possible.

One of my best friends just moved to Alhambra so I yelped restaurants in the area for us to try during my visit and I'm so happy we found this spot! I had the breakfast plate with cha shu, eggs, & rice and I also split an order of macadamia nut french toast with my friend.  Everything was sooooooo good. The cha shu pork was packed full of flavor!  I've been to a Hawaiian spot like this in SF and enjoyed their macadamia nut pancakes, but after having the macadamia nut sauce from this spot I now have a new standard.  I need to go back to visit her soon so I can eat here again!

Yuko Kitchen has become one of my favorite lunch spots. Everything I've ordered has been delicious. It's definitely a more American version of Asian food, but the flavors are still really good. I also love that all the food tastes healthy because they add so many greens. I've ordered the chicken teriyaki bowl and salad, as well as the salmon skin salad. All of these items were so good and very refreshing. Oh and the portion sizes are huge so it's totally worth your money. As far as drinks go, I love their mint lemonade. It always refreshes me on a warm day. I definitely recommend this place.

I just got 6 flavors for the price of 5. The triple chocolate is mouth watering delicious, if I wouldn't know how good it was I wouldn't got 3 more of that flavor! I'm actually going to Long Beach to find them tonight to get more cause I already are all of it last night!!! The Mexican Chocolate with wild Raspberrys was also a treat. I've got 4 more in the freezer that I'm afraid to open fire to the fact I'm sure I'll eat the whole thing as soon as I open it. I am extremely excited to try the Raspberry Ghostpepper Gelato!

When there's a cafe in the NoHo Arts District, coffee and art will naturally share the spotlight.  Only in this case, the art is more immediate because as soon as you walk in, you're confronted with a 16x14 foot chalkboard wall which serves as an immense indoor canvas.  A local artist is selected to create a mural and it stays featured for a few months.  That's definitely some cool exposure.  Additional artwork is propped and hung up all around the space too.As for the coffee, they use Seattle-based Herkimer Coffee.  One of their unique offerings are their different flavored lattes -- brown sugar cinnamon, red velvet, maple bacon, salted caramel and LAVENDER, which is the one I had.  Pretty good!

Gastrobus is 3.5 stars for food alone. $6 for a filling and delicious pulled-pork sandwich seems like a decent value at one of these nouveau food trucks.  The sandwich had a lot of bread but it didn't taste dry at all.  We also tried refreshing samples of the corn salad.  It was delicious but it was more of a salsa than a salad.  I think the sample size was perfect and I'm not sure if I could have eaten more salad.There's a man dressed up as giant nose next to the truck waving at people.  It's fairly entertaining and the nose looks more ridiculous than the Stanford tree. It is worthy of 1/2 a star.

I luv luv luv luv this place.  And it is not because one of the people I knew recommend me to go to this place because his uncle owned it.  Well, maybe that.  But this place is better than KT cafe even though both are good.  I loved that their services are really friendly and quick AND attentive.  The pricing is good, like KT, it is very cheap!  I had grilled Chicken Steak with Black Pepper Sauce and it came fast. The waitiress was constantly asking if I need more Cold Iced Lemon Tea.  Friendly service and nice decor.  Again, luv luv luv.

Doubting Thomas is a *new* coffee bar & bakery located in Westlake area of Los Angeles (since May 2018).  I was in the area for Zumba and arrived an hour early (zoom zoom), so I hung out at this cafe for a little bit.I ordered a pourover coffee (from Colombia) and a coffee cake.  NOM NOM NOM.  I really love pourover coffee and don't drink it nearly enough, so it was a nice treat!  On the menu, there are other items for breakfast / brunch / lunch (including breakfast burritos, quesadilla, breakfast sandwiches, rice bowls, etc).  At the time of visiting (Sunday around lunchtime), the wait was about 35 minutes.  So..... don't go hangry!!  Cute cafe.  Cute atmosphere.  Hipster-ish.  Street parking.  ENJOY!!

We stayed in LA for a week in an apartment above Plan Check - proximity made this our go to spot for food, drinks and snacks. For snacks they have a nice crab dip and a meat/cheese board. For mains, I had several things on the menu including the fried chicken and waffles. All were tasty. They have nice selection of beers on tap and also some decent wines by the glass. They also have a specialty cocktail menu. Prices were decent, happy hour specials made things even more affordable. Service was always fast and friendly. If you want a quick drink or a long meal I think you will be accommodated.

I used to live around the corner from this place so I went quite often. It's really great and never disappointed. I now live in Northern California, but whenever I come down to visit family I do my best to make a stop here. I've even got my boyfriend from up north craving it. In fact, we're going out there today.I've never had the garlic chicken though it always looks and smells so good. I've gotten the lamb in wine sauce and the garlic shrimp scampi and both are amazingly delicious. They both come with rice, black beans, and oh-so-yummy plantains.Make sure to get some sangria too. Yum :)

The waiting time is ridiculous, took over an hour to be seated.The food was great, ordered the eggs Benedict (fried chicken and another order of the avocado ones) with potato bites. The taste was amazing! The angus burger was decent, very flavorful.The Ricotta pancakes, were good.
