(Not sure if I'll order them again).The latte is not special in taste but looks amazing and is only $8.The mimosa flight was ok -mostly instagram friendly - NOT so much like damn they're bombWe really wanted to try the French toast, but they ran out.We received excellent service from Erick.Will definitely go again.

Overall fantastic pasta and pizza dough quality! I've dined here a few times during the week during lunchtime and never had any trouble with the line being too long/finding close parking in the structure. I usually dine here with a friend and split a pizza/pasta/appetizer which is more than enough and you get to try a variety of menu items. The beef ragu is one of my favorites and a must try for first timers! One must also take a walk through the extravagant market area and please do yourself a favor and bring home some parmigiana or a burrata.

The things that set this Korean barbecue place apart from the rest are high quality meats, good service (they will cook most of the meat for you if you want), and extra sides like steamed egg.We got the large beef combination, which was just a little over $100. We weren't sure how much food it would cover, but it easily fed five of us. (4 adult appetites and one preteen).  After tax and tip, it was a little under $150.  We went at 5 PM on a Saturday and had to wait about 15 minutes. By the time we left a little after six, there were quite a few people waiting outside the door.

High end hot dogs and beer -- that's it... And it works perfectly.  Mix in some DJs on the weekend and the place is packed.  25 beers on tap from Belgian/Germany and excellent choice of bottled beers from Belgian, Germany and England round out a beer connoisseur's dream.   Hot dogs from rattle snake to rabbit to traditional German brats are cooked to perfection. They are accompanied with grilled onions, sauerkraut and 4 different kinds of mustard.  The fries are also delicious, with so many dipping sauces it makes you feel like you are in Europe more than Venice.  It's a great spot, unique and reliable.

When I first heard about the fruit cart, I was scared that I was going to get sick, but she came highly recommended by my friends. But I went anyways (no fear) and I fell in love. The watermelon and pineapple is always sweet, the coconut is not the soft kind but the flavor is right, and the mangos aren't necessarily always in season, but still... $4 for a whole box of fruit... amazing.I've now moved to Seattle, and I still think about her when I need a sweet snack or I'm hungry for some fruit or when I want coconut... le sigh.

I came on a Saturday for lunch and this place was packed! My party of 5 snagged the last open table. I ordered the tofu yuk dae jang and shared an order of the kimchi and pork dumplings. Everything was amazing. The dumplings was stuffed with filling and steamed to perfection. The yuk dae jang was also perfect. It was just the right amount of spiciness, and eating it piping hot made it that much more delicious. Yuk Dae Jang is shared with other stores in a plaza, and there is free parking out front. But most, if not all, of the spots are super compact so be careful when parking.

this place is delish!!! our server looked like an actor and he was super nice, totally fit the chic & trendy atmosphere... i would say this is a perfect date spot or even a day out catching up with friends!!! ended up getting the CRUNCHY FRENCH TOAST (french toast layered in an egg batter with corn flakes, vanilla some sort of amazing milky syrup thing it comes with, and fresh strawberries, bananas, and blueberries), & the NORWEIGEN  BENEDICT (salmon, spinach, poached egg, hollandaise sauce, potatoes). both to absolutely die for! can't wait to try the next items i already have on my list!

Okay guys this is a place you lucky you get table when I pulled in parking lot line was out the door I know the food must be good right there and then this place deserves more stars than the sky it is impossible to find quality Middle Eastern food anywhere else I'm coming back tomorrow with my family the kabobs and the chicken shawarma undescribable falafel feels like a water in your mouth I just don't wanna type all day because I truly do want to just stop by this place and this will be your favorite spot guarantee

First heard about this deli while doing a food tour in Santa Monica. It's always crowded and you know food is good when the place is busy.  They sell not only deli sandwiches but also pastas. You can take a number and order a sandwich made fresh or grab their already made sandwiches to avoid the wait. They are known for their godmother sandwich. I'm usually not a cold sandwich persin but even for me...the godmother was really good! Perfect blend of flavors. You can also customize your sandwich, but definitely start off with the godmother. You won't regret it!

I came in to find a quick treat. I got an iced matcha latte with blue agave and it was yummy! It cost around $6. My palette is pretty accustomed to the raw stuff so I found the prices and taste alright. I think if you want to be extremely healthy then this is definitely one destination. It's also a really relaxing and fun place to chill and be on your laptop. The girl who helped me was the sweetest! She wrote on my cup good luck! after I told her about my interview. I will definitely come back for an actual meal.

The reason people love this place is because it has very good sushi at an affordable rate.  It's not gonna be the most amazing sushi you'll ever have, but it's quite good for the price.  I usually get the sashimi deluxe, which comes with an assortment of fish.  It's usually random as to what you get, but hopefully that day they have toro because, in my opinion, that is the best fish there.  Overall, all the fish is very fresh.The biggest negative is that there is always a long wait.  People start lining up before the restaurant is even open.

This is a solid and fine food establishment for the Sawtelle strip of Asia I hold near and dear to my heart.  The food rolls, and ramen, and everything they bring out is affordable and good.  Whether you're a local UCLA grad student, or a Brentwood young professional I would highly recommend this place.  Do not expect to be wowed by the food, expect to come here hungry if you want Korean food.  I can't comment on this place at night because I could totally see the service being bad based on how attentive the server was during lunch.  But I definitely see this place as a solid lunch spot if I'm having a meeting in the area.

Not too shabby for NY-Style pies. Got a couple of slices and an order of garlic rolls (aka knots). Slices came out hot n ready, but too damn crispy and almost burnt! Taste was okay though. I prefer a much bigger slice, but these guys nailed the basic principles. Decor is a little clich  with all the subway signs and props...(would have liked to see graffiti on the painted subway cars=more realistic). If it weren't for the pizzas everywhere, you'd almost forget you're at a pizzeria and think you were at Subway.  I realize that this place has been around a loooooong time, but might be time for an update.  Add some or bring back Italian Ices.Ciao!

Highly recommend anyone visiting downtown to check Grand Central Market out. This place has so many eateries all in one location. If you come with friends it's great because you can all try a little bit of everything. By the way it gets really crowded on the weekends - just a heads up.Seating: can be hard to find at times on the first floor, so check the lower level because there is more seating down there. The lower level is located in the same area as the bathrooms. Parking: There is a parking structure right next to the market. Prices are as follows: - First 90 min for $3- $2 each 15 minutes after 90 min- Daily max/lost ticket - $25

This is by far one of the best breakfasts I have ever had. I order a sweet crepe and my wife ordered the goat cheese and spinach quiche, both were EXCELLENT. If you are looking for a new place that has great French crepes or quiche this is the place to go. I took my wife here from her birthday and I will have to say we were not disappointed from our first encounter. We will definitely go here again. We want to try all the other crepes and sandwiches. It is decently priced and the amount of food you get when you order the crepe was worth every bite.!

One of my favorite spots for tasty bbq and fried chicken. I had the bbq and chicken combo plate which comes with two sides. Of course I had the juicy fried chicken and the Memphis baby back ribs. The sides I picked were baked bbq beans and Mac and cheese. Honestly, I wasn't a big fan of the Mac and cheese. It was a little too dry for my taste but the baked beans were perfect. I strongly suggest making reservations cause it gets really busy. Super cute and laid back place for a nice meal. Parking on the side of the restaurant and back (it's get full especially during dinner time). You can also find parking on the street.

Before leaving LA, we finally went here on Sunday afternoon to get something to eat before driving back to the Bay Area. I ordered (3) cheese rolls, a banana split smoothie, and a strawberry and cream cheese croissant. DELICIOUS!I should've brought back a dozen of the cheese bread with me, but I didn't want it sitting in my hot car for the 6 hr drive so I will have to wait till we come back for Labor Day Weekend. Can't wait to try their fruit tart, guava bread and empanadas.. Till next time SoCal! I wished they open a location in the SF Bay Area..

This place is great. The atmosphere is inviting, and everyone who works here is genuine and knowledgeable, as well as able and competent to have a conversation which many of the places in the area tend to lack. I skate past this place every day on Broadway on my way to work. The lattes are unbeatable and stumptown coffee is always a winner. I have yet to try the sandwiches... But I'll post a photo, the bread looks superb. I like this spot because it's inviting, people are down to earth, there's thought put in to the little details, and the product you get is 5 stars...

First off, the meat is fresh and the cuts are thick and juicy.  They helped us out with the order, so we don't order too much.  We opted for individual meat dishes, rather than the combo.  I don't think it was any more expensive either, plus we got to try both beef and pork.  Amazing service!  The servers are very attentive about changing the grill pans, cooking and cutting for the table.  Also worth mentioning is their ventilation.  Pretty good!  Mostly we left smelling as good as we came in.  Can't say the same about garlic breath tho :-PAnd even before I ever got there, they had me at explosive fried rice... And it did not disappoint!

Poppy and Rose is my ideal kind of brunch spot. Interesting menu options, fresh ingredients, and reasonable prices. I ordered the bagel and lox and it was the best rendition I've had in recent memory. It came stuffed with buttery smoked salmon, arugula, heirloom tomato, onion, and an olive oil drizzle. I added avocado and it was well worth it. They forgot my cream cheese initially but were happy to give me a tub when I asked (just plain ol' Philadelphia...the only small let down). Friendly service willing to offer recommendations. Coffee didn't stay topped up at all times, but it was quickly refilled when requested.

So delicious. I went to the san gabriel location first, and had never been to the original location. It's small, and was packed on a weekend for lunchtime, at 1pm, the wait was maybe 20 minutes?Ordered the galbi jim, which was just like i remembered it. So rich and savory, not too spicy, great floral chili flavor, and the beef just tasted so beefy. The potatoes were also rich and creamy, as if they were roasted rather than simply boiled. The kimchi and ban chan were delicious as well.A little cramped space-wise, and it is a little pricey, but worth it. This is comfort food at its finest.

Where do I start with this breakfast/brunch adventure. Foxy's restaurant has a classic diner vibe to it! The booths are comfortable couches with soft clean pillows to lean on while eating. The ambiance is perfect for breakfast/brunch.The food portion is large and delicious! Be prepared to come with an empty stomach because you will be stuffed! Parking can be an issue! They have parking but it fills quick, so you can park for free at the promenade around the corner and walk if needed. The service is phenomenal as well! Be sure to check this place out & enjoy the picture

I've been to a few Brazilian Churrascaria out in the East Coast, the best thing is you can never go wrong with these places.  If you love eating meats this is a great place to go.  Comparing the salad bar to a few others I have been too it's quite small.  I think the reason for the small salad bar is because the restaurant is small too.  By far this place has the best flavored and cooked meats.  My favorite is the lamb chops, slow roast beef, and the chicken hearts.  I would go to this place again if I was to visit LA. Two thumbs up.

We tried their Swedish crepes, the tacos with Carne Asada, and one other dish I forgot the name of. Everything was really good!The tacos I got had these mashed potatoes instead of beans at the bottom of the shell and it was delicious! The Carne had so much flavor! My boyfriends dish was super good too! He had this dish with egg and mushrooms with some sort of sauce at the bottom. It was so good! The crepes were a good cooling dish because after trying their hot sauces we needed it haha.There's a lot of parking in front of the store and the area looks a little shady but I will definitely be going back!

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time. Waited 45 mins to be seated at a table for two. Parking is not the most convenient here, but it's discounted after validation. I ordered salmon teriyaki and sashimi dish. They came separately, which I didn't expect. The order also came with miso soup, pickled dish, tofu and meat, and rice. The sashimi melts in your mouth, the tofu was warm and savory, but the teriyaki was a little too salty for me. Otherwise, it was a good meal. Be prepared to get rushed because of the line of people waiting to eat!

This is probably my favorite restaurant in Burbank. It's a hidden gem off the beaten path. Their rice and beans are to die for. I highly recommend the La Bamba Special.They have gigantic portions. All the seating is in a large open-air, covered patio. They have TVs usually tuned to sports. They serve beer, wine, mimosas, shakes and soda.The food is supposedly Cuban or Caribbean, but there are plenty of items for the American palette. Don't get caught up in the hype around those who had trouble with groupons. Order something with rice and beans in it and you're going to love it.

What you see in those pics isn't what you taste, it's better! The best French place in town and you won't know it. Because this amazing restaurant isn't in the glamorous side of the city. It's hidden somewhere on Robertson St. You have to sneak in with your bottle of wine and embrace the French experience in every since of word. The homey atmosphere, the music, the excellent service and not to forget the warm greeting of the owner himself Chef Christian Royere from the minute you snuck into the place. Yes, you sneak in. shushhhh.. don't tell the other restaurants, it's A Food Affair

This joint is a really nice place to go to if you're looking for savory or sweet foods to get!! I didn't order anything savory, but I'll save that for the next time I come back to the farmer's market. I ordered the LA metro which was just sugar and butter...which is super simple yeah... but it was really yummy! The crepe was soft which I really like and filling was just right...not too sweet and not overly sweet either. The guys working here take orders fast and make the crepes quick considering how busy the farmers market can be.

This is probably makes it to my top 5 ramen places and ive been to a bunch in the bay area. Had to wait like a hour on a late Sunday night (around 9). At least they serve everyone who gets on the list before they close. I got the spicy miso. Perfect amount of spiceyness, good portion, broth was excellent, price was reasonable. Service was good. They didn't take too long to bring the food out and refilled our waters as needed. Nothing to complain about, just don't like to wait :) Parking was a beezy though, had to park quite a few blocks away. Nevertheless, I'd go back

If you're looking for burgers and beer, you can't go wrong with Plan Check. It's a fun place with nice wooden tables and copious amounts of outdoor seating. The burgers here are layered with lots of awesome fixins. You really can't go wrong with the PCB, or even the Southern Fry if you're feeling like having some fried chicken. The burgers come with ample protein that can satiate almost any appetite. For starters, the crab dip is solid, but the stuffed mushroom will be a welcome addition as well. Beer selection is pretty good. They also have a decent list of whiskies as well, including the Macallan 18. Street and valet parking available. Will definitely be back.

This place is Cafe heaven. Not only they carry a wide selection of delicious frozen yogurts, they serve all kinds of different foods. The Katella Nutella is an all time favorite. The waffles are amazing.They are made from scratch, so good they are addictive. Plus i like the Dartboard idea (hit the bullseye and the the order is free). The drinks they make are pretty cool too (wish i knew the secret recipes of how they mix  different iceas teas and juices to come up with the refreshing flavors). I am glad we found this place one night after a long day at Disneyland. and ever since we have been frequenting this place as often as we can.

I came here with my husband and two kids for lunch. The service was excellent they are very attentive and the food was awesome. We ordered a platter that included two sides and three meats . We had the chicken, brisket, and ribs along with a side of Mac n cheese and potato salad and peach cobbler for desert. Everything was delicious, the brisket was so tender and the bbq was spicy and tangy. My husband got a bucket of 4 cans of beer and you get to take the bucket home along with 2 beer glasses so that was cool. This place is so worth it !!!

First time here recommended by a friend and it was great! There was a large crowd waiting to be seated but the restaurant is really good about having open seating outside if you're waiting. We sat on a nice cushioned bench in the shade for maybe less than 10 minutes before we got a two-seater. The interior is really nice and the cabin aesthetic really adds to the experience. I ordered coffee and the turkey club and both were great. Nothing extraordinary, but it was a great meal. I even got a complimentary candy when I paid the bill. Sweet staff, attentive service, will be going back for sure.

I've been wanting to try this place for such a long time, and I'm so glad I did!Their build your own burritos were absolutely delicious, and I'm glad I listened to the worker who suggested their spiciest sauce because it was the perfect pairing to the other ingredients. For how small the burrito is, it was extremely filling! It was also very quick. My friend and I only waited a couple of minutes for our orders.There were also quite a few dogs who sat near us while we were eating so that was definitely a plus.Wake & Late was the perfect place to come for a quick bite and a catch up, and I'd definitely recommend it!

Old school since 1946. Expect to wait for a table on the weekend, so make a reservation or you might get stuck eating at Pollo Loco across the street. I've been coming here for years both for breakfast and dinner. This time around I ordered the BBQ two meat combo with baby back ribs, blackened chicken, cream corn, and garlic mashed potatoes. Before I received my food I ordered a 23 oz 1903 Craftsman beer on tap for $8, a very good deal indeed. I was starving and as soon as my food came I wolfed it down leaving my fingers a BBQ mess.

Came here for the first time on a Saturday night at around 10pm. It was a great atmosphere for a date night and I loved the decor. The server recommended the Cucumber Lemongrass martini (so good!) and I also tried the lychee mule (good choice if you like lychee). The pork buns were bomb and the Kuala Lumpur noodles were our fave. We ordered the princess chicken recommended by other yelpers, and it was good, but I could barely eat more than one after the app and noodles! Overall, our server was good and he made those good recommendations, so no complaints here!

Very Chill place!  I was there on a Thursday around 9-12. I was meting a friend for a sit down meeting.  Because of all the reviews, we chose to meet here. We sat down to talk and the people ther were just doing the same.  People were on their computers, meeting, friends talking, solo people just drinking, etc... The free WiFI was the total draw for us to go.  I'm go glad we did! We talked to people around us, we drank good coffee, and enjoyed the atmosphere well! Parking wasn't a problem when we went, but I can see how it can be. Read the signs! At any rate, go to this place!

These turkey legs by themselves almost constitute their own meal! They are juicy, delicious, tender, and HUGE! One of my favorite things to do while waiting in line is munch on amazing poultry meat. For $8 you get a lot of food and it is one of the most satisfying snacks that you can only get at DLand/DCA. The chimichangas here are okay, pretty filling if you can't afford the Turkey leg. But go for the Tukey Leg once you get the chance! Everyone has to experience one of these at least once in your life! Try to get one when you see them coming out of the oven, those ones are the freshest and the best :)

Came for dinner with a friend. It's best to reserve ahead of time. The restaurant isn't the biggest and they always are  busy. There is an outside patio but it's right next to their parking lot and a busy street, which can dampen the atmosphere. Try to get a seat inside the restaurant. We got the brussel sprouts and I got a cauliflower risotto. It was pretty good, although on the pricey end. My friend really liked her fish dish. Everything was pretty filling and I had a great time with my friend. The servers here are also quite attentive, which is a plus.

Came here with my muggle friends at my insistence...  \_(?)_/   #HPGANG The food is more on the pricey side, but the portions are pretty generous. I ordered the Sunday roast - prime rib with steamed veggies, roasted potatoes and a biscuit. The prime rib was good. It wasn't the best I've ever had, but I was satisfied. All of the sides were delicious! My favorite was the biscuit -- so fluffy and buttery! The fish and chips seemed to be a super popular choice. It smelled amazing and I almost regretted ordering the prime rib. Next time, for sure! ;) So would I come back? DUH! Harry Potter = LOML

The line takes over an hour on the weekends but luckily if you go with a group you all can take turns saving your place in line and explore the rest of the market. There's free tea samples at a booth nearby, and the mango sticky rice is a must try (but it's only available in the summer sadly) LA is always about the hype but eggslut lives up to it. I've been here twice and ordered the sandwich that comes with cheese and bacon, the chipotle ketchup makes it the perfect brunch. They play hip hop while you eat at the bar or you can order it to go. Be prepared to wait but it's worth it!

Crave Cafe is awesome, and consequently, they get busy later in the night.I like their panini sandwiches. I've tried their turkey panini, with side salad, and iced tea. Their food is good quality, so it is worth the wait.They have an assortment of other foods as well, although I have not tried them yet. The place hosts plenty of seating, and if you get lucky you can sit on a comfy couch. They have outdoor seating as well, but it's a bit too chilly this winter to sit outside.The place is clean, the patrons orderly, and they're efficiently run. Updates with photos to come. Stay tuned.

We ordered magal pork and beef. The image shows one serving of magal beef. Its alot smaller than we thought since its for ~$30 for magal beef. But the beef is tender and DELICIOUS. Its pricey so if you have room in your budget come! Service is nice. They give you free 200g if you leave a review.At the end of the meal, all things considered I was full. 2 orders of meat(+1more) soybean paste stew, bibimbap, and the volcano thing between 4 ppl total just under $100 it worth it. Way better than going AYCE for similar price.

Came in today and tried oldies eggs. There's scrambled eggs with spinach and vegetables. It was really good came with a large side of potatoes and two slices of rye bread.  I subtracted the start due to being charged 350 for a glass of iced tea which I thought was extravagant. So the total cost was around $20. I love the Decour in the restaurant it really does have the feel of an old-time diner plus I really enjoyed the classic jazz music they play. It's got a nice atmosphere. I just wish the cost for more in line with what you would typically expect around 12 or $13 total.

10/10 would recommend!Shrimp Daddy is definitely my go to at Smorgasburg! A simple menu, but beyond delicious. All the right flavors!The garlic shrimp plate $14The pineapple boat $17Perfectly cooked garlic shrimp with shells so crispy you can eat them, flavor galore, rice with extra sauce atop it, pineapples, and Mac salad.So delicious!Not only is the food incredible, but the staff is extremely friendly. Their line is always extremely long, so that means a lot of waiting --- but I usually go there early before the line gets long. But that long line just goes to show how tasty the food is!I'll definitely be back again and again!

Rutt's Hawaiian cafe is a great place to spend a lazy meal.  From the Hawaiian hut decorations to the lazy vibe to the cheap food, what more can you ask for?I usually actually get the junior portions (around 5.99) since I don't want to pass out after lunch, but I've done the regular portions as well.The kahlua pork with cabbage is pretty tasty with rice and a side of mac salad.  The loco moco is all kinds of ooey gooey delicious too.  Spam, at it's best.  Definitely check it out if you're on a budget and want a lot of food.

Parking is a huge pain. There is valet for $7 or you can loop around and may get lucky! Just like urth caffe, you grab the menu upon entering and pay in advance with a table number. Then you'd grab your beverage and pick any available table inside or out. I love how they have tons of patio seating! When its busy the host will help you find a table. And at night the lights make you feel super cozy& very romantic spot!Ive had their chocolate bread pudding, coffees, lattes, juice, enchilada, turkey burger, granola parfait, tacos, breakfast hurritos, chips and guac, crepes, and more! I keep coming back because its definitely worth the trip!

I LOVE Tara's and have been back here many times. The korma (with vegetable or any of the protein choices) is hands down my favorite item on their menu. SO DELICIOUS. The Raisin Paratha is my favorite bread... just the right amount of sweetness and goes well with all the dishes. Honestly, I don't think you could go wrong with anything here. There's a tiny parking lot behind the restaurant, but the entrance is very easy to miss! It's a narrow driveway on the right side of the restaurant. The restaurant is busy but never packed, so you don't have to wait for a table fortunately (at least never when I've went).

I wish they were in NYC, too! I'm so glad I came across this gem on the last day of my trip to LA. I ordered the Slut and a Bacon, Egg & Cheese. Both were very delicious. I ate the Slut right away because it's probably best to have it hot/warm rather than cold. The potato pur e at the bottom was so smooth and the egg was cooked to perfection! I saved the BEC for the plane ride home. I'm so glad I did, because it hit the spot -- even when it was cold. My only regret was not ordering OJ. I think that would've completed the meal. Next time, for sure!

Elegant and super spacious coffee shop in the heart of DTLA with on point latte's and cappuccinos.  Plenty of room to get your work did as well as outlets and WIFI!If you want to try something different, you can get their drinks with charcoal in it.  Had it once but I really just prefer my drinks without the charcoal.  Bathroom setup is perfect, it's kept clean and there are 3 bathrooms!The workers here are very friendly and helpful.The only thing I'm not a fan of is the hours, they open late at 8AM during the week and 9AM on Sunday.

My boyfriend tricked me into going to California for vacation just so he can eat The Godmother sandwich! True story. I gotta admit it was a delicious sandwich and a great Italian deli overall. I tried multiple items on the menu as well as desserts  and I wasn't dissapointed. We even picked up some pasta to take back to Chicago as my boyfriend insisted we will not find pasta like that one at home (big eye roll). I would give this place 4 stars because the prices were sky high but my boyfriend might choke me to death if I rate this place anything less than 5 stars.

This place is fantastic! Order yourself so you don't have to wait for table service, although all the employees are really sweet. Had the turkey sandwich on cranberry bread with homemade kettle chips (so yummy and fresh).They also use boars head and give you an insane amount of meat- well worth the price. We also had the chicken Fried steak, which had a great flavor and fry, although the portion of the plate was large, it was mostly mashed potatoes and eggs. The chicken, for the price, was a little smaller than a typical chicken fried steak. Drinks are extra large as well. Overall solid place and I crave that sandwich all the time now.

Chocofruit shares the same store as Poke Spot so don't be deterred that you are in the wrong place. My boyfriend and I originally came for a poke bowl. As we were eating, the nice gentleman from Chocofruit gave us a free sample. It was really yummy so after we finished eating we ordered the sushi crepe platter? (forgot the name) to go. He was extremely friendly and my boyfriend and I were more than happy with his service. After we paid, he even offered us a free ice cream. It's easy to see how hard working he is and we will definitely be back again to try some of the other desserts on the menu!

My girlfriend and I ended up going here because another local eatery up the block wasn't able to seat us, and we're very glad they weren't!  Republique sat us almost instantly at a communal table, and even let us sample different cheese while we waited. We ordered the Spaghetti Rustichella and the Red Snapper and both were delicious, especially the spaghetti. For desert, we ordered the Chocolate, Peanut butter and Banana which was amazing, and even came with a side of Nutella not chocolate. Everything was seasoned perfectly, and it was all so fresh (everything is made in house, even the pasta). I'd definitely go back, and recommend to anyone interested in eating delicious, fresh, and homemade food.

First time at Bacaro LA and we used a groupon for Saturday brunch. Parking was very tight but found street parking a few blocks away...not a big deal though. Was seated right away, looked over the brunch menu, and told that the Pancakes and Bacaro burger were 2 items that were the most filling. Order the 2 items and I have to admit..was pretty full after. Great atmosphere but was a bit loud. I live in South OC but came down to visit some friends and decided to try this place. Would I comeback to Bacaro LA? Maybe.

I am a fan of Han Bat Sul Lung Tang. Coming from Toronto, there are not many places in Canada that can replicate this authentic Korean dish.dugi (rI ordered the salgogi (beef) and it was delicious, simple, and heart-warming. Great soup for a hangover!It comes with a side bowl of rice, and various kimchis. Kakkdugi (radish kimchi) was crunchy, fresh, and not too spicy.If you are adventurous enough to try the mix sul lang tang with lung, heart, and other organs, go for it! My friend said it was delicious !Prices are fair, around $10 for each soup.

Deeelish crepes and coffee! We had 2 of the cold crepes- Nutella cream, banana and chocolate cream and a hot butter and sugar and all 3 were perfection! Crepe was sweet and thin but enough to hold the filling. The butter and sugar crepe was crispy and oh so splendidly good! We also had the Americano and a Duet boba- which consisted of milk tea and a shot of espresso. Their coffee was remarkably bold and smooth in flavor. Their Duet boba was precisely the flavor I was craving for! Will certainly stop by for more of their choices. One of the best crepes I've ever had!!!

This place is amazing. First off you don't have to worry about choosing to eat breakfast lunch or dinner because THEY SERVE THEM ALL. The menu is OUT OF BOUNDS ridiculous with the numerous choices and endless combination options. I end up getting something new every time I eat here and I probably won't have the same thing twice, it's that good. The pricing is reasonable and you definitely won't leave hungry... For this particular visit I got a strawberry and Nutella crepe and it surely did not disappoint. If you're looking for a go-to spot in the valley, look no further. Oh yeah, they're also open 24/7...perfect for the late night CRAVES...pun intended.

So good. We tried the duck and Italian hot sausage with some truffle fries and a big cup of beer. The sausages were both really great and so was the fries. When you bite into it it's cooked perfectly has a nice bite to it and it's tender and juicy. The style of ordering is similar to a corner bakery chain if you ever been. You order at a counter and they give you a table number and they bring the food to you. The service was super friendly if I'm ever in the LA area I would deff stop by.

Oh wow. First time here, where sited next to the window (not the best place but we didn't care). Service was ok. We ordered the wild crab dumplings, the spicy chicken dumplings, the juicy pork dumplings and the cabbage salad. Everything was really tasty, the cabbage salad was a nice surprise (make sure you add the lemon), but omg, the juicy pork dumplings are amazing! (Heads up: they contain peanuts and they are hot and literally juicy, so mind your bites). Got a free milk bun desert (thanks yelp!), wasn't really crazy about it. Go for the juicy pork dumplings ;)

I love brunch. I love great, friendly service. I love delicious food that uses ingredients you wouldn't necessarily put together (i.e. French and Mexican).  So... I loved this place. I came on a Monday morning so the line was very reasonable (maybe a 10 minute wait to be seated), and the servers were very prompt and friendly. I had the crepe and would order it over and over again, and most other diners around me were making the same comments about their dishes.  If I was the only one in the restaurant, I might have awkwardly licked the plate clean but unfortunately, that's not entirely socially appropriate.

So I was craving pizza and due to my recent much needed lifestyle change I had to cut out my dairy, so thank you pizzanisata for having a vegan vegi pizza.  This was my very first experience having vegan pizza and I must say it was very delicious!  The set up is small but the space was well used and I thoughly enjoyed the islander beats in the background, customer service was awesome as well. They ran out of the vegan vegi pizza and the owner was kind enough to throw in an extra slice for waiting. I'm very satisfied with my experience and definitely will be back when I have my pizza craving!

I love coming here even if it's just for a quick moment to order a macaron or two or three or four. For my last visit, I ordered the coconut, salted caramel, earl grey, and lemon for myself and the family. These delectable desserts were some of the best we've had!The bakery was very efficient the night I went and I truly believe that this inclusion truly boosts its rating. The macarons are absolutely wonderful and you may even get tempted to purchase a box of them to help you pass time by on your walk back to your car or throughout the iconic traffic in the city. Definitely a diamond in the wondrous rough!

This place is truly amazing. We have been about three times now and will continue to go. They have a wide array of fresh seafood offerings. We've ordered oysters, shrimp cocktails, lobster rolls, hamachi crudo and other dishes and they have all been amazing. The restaurant has a great vibe to it as well; with the option of sitting upstairs in their beautiful patio. All of the staff members have always been very friendly and welcoming throughout our visits. Prices are about what you'd expect to fresh seafood, I'd say expect to spend around $100 for two people with a drink each. Highly recommended.

I love this truck! So many veggie options. I don't usually have good experiences with food trucks because I am vegetarian. All I can usually get are fries or a quesadilla. This truck had so many choices it was crazy. We ordered the veggie tacos and veggie nachos. They piled the toppings high and everything tasted great.  The truck was parked  on 5th St, by Pershing Square. I'm not sure if they ever move but I have seen them there on numerous occasions. Please check them out if you are ever bar hopping in the area. Especially my vegetarian friends.

I donut feel completed without you now! I am all in for this tofu donut hype. Flavor Rating: Pumpkin Spice 2/5 (too much spice) Honey 4/5 Matcha 4.5/5Do not compare this to the familiar donut we all know. Rather, the baked tofu donut more closely resembles a cake texture. Upon first bites, it reminded me of the Japanese gift box small bite-sized castella cake. I appreciate the locally sourced & Japan sourced ingredients (tofu, rice flour, honey, sugar, matcha, etc) which truly set them apart. The emphasis on quality justifies the price point of these baked tofu donuts. Donut mind me - I'll have another dozen please!

Noms!! Went here yesterday and got the chicken plate. So much food!! I really enjoyed it and was so full after. The food is way better here than probably anywhere else in the park. I will be going here from now on whenever I'm at the park. Oh, also, if there is a long line for butterbeer go here!Overall:Atmosphere: Legit. It definitely makes all of my Harry Potter dreams come trueFood: WickedDrinks: They offer everything the butterbeer trucks offer I believePricing: Sort of pricey, but you are at a theme park. I think the chicken plate ended up being like $15Customer Service: Top notch of course

Delicious pretty little desserts! I love that they are open late; you can stop by while bar hopping.This place always seems full of people sitting and enjoying their food or peering at the myriad dessert options, but once I've picked out my treat I've never had to wait at the cashier.I have not yet dined here but will definitely be back many times for more dessert.Sweets reviewLa vanille flocage: tasty white chocolate flavor; nothing special, will not order again Chocolate hazelnut beignet: waste of time -- might as well spoon Nutella bc there is no added value here; not served hot like you can get (far far away) at jazz kitchen in Downtown Disney or Cafe Dumonde

Were we just in LA to eat or what?! I was so lucky to have been introduced to this amazing ramen joint in LA. The original location was closed due to renovations but they moved just a few steps down the block to their temporary location. Wait-time was just about 15 minutes for a group of 5. We each ordered the Daikoku Ramen. I took my first bite and WOW! The best handcrafted ramen I've ever had. The broth was thick, rich in flavor, and not too salty. Generous portions along with a friendly waitstaff. Not much more to say- just go and try it!

This was my last meal out on my two week trip to California.  It didn't disappoint.  I got the Brunch Carbonara, which was definitely out of the box.  It was like a risotto, but not quite as creamy.  Great flavors, it had bacon, peas and Parmesan and it was topped with two poached eggs.  The bacon was crispy and the eggs were poached really nicely.  It was a pretty dish, someone even stopped on their way by the table to ask what I ordered.I also got a blueberry pancake on the side, which was really good.  It was sweet and tasted like vanilla was in the batter, which I really like.

Salju-vating over some taro snow ice at Salju!Food: Taro Snow Ice w/ Condensed Milk, Strawberries, and MangoesPrice: $4.50 (small)Ratings: I love salju's range of flavors! I really like their Taro, mango, matcha, and Thai tea flavor. It's pretty strong! Their snow ice is very fluffy and doesn't melt as fast. For the small, it's a pretty good amount! It comes with one free syrup and two free toppings. They also sell crepes, brick toast, and drinks. However, they're more known for their snow ice! There's a couple of tables inside and ambiance is very bright! Service is pretty good here! There's a couple of parking in their small plaza.

2nd time at LA's Smorgasburg. Highlights include:Goa taco with their slow roasted pork belly roti taco Stoked with their Tri-tip sandwich topped with grilled cheese bunKalan with Elvio tater tots with adobo, chimchuri sauce, and chicharon cracklings Wanderlust with their Ube ice cream on ube cone, sticky mango rice, yellow watermelon mint, blueberry, and hibiscus rose water Ensaymada project - multiflavor Filipino brioche - went for three flavors: red velvet, Oreo, and matcha chocolate filling Little Spoon Frozen pudding - not pictured - get their campfire  chocolate PopDup - lychee oolong tea in a jar - great to cool off under the hot sun Skip Lobsterdramus nachos, We have Noodles, and Sticky Rice on Wheels Pad ThaiThat's it that's all we can eat for now

Came here from staying at Roadway Inn right next door! Took us about 5 minutes to get a table for two even with the place packed!This place is super cute and fancy! I could see a more romantic setting at night. The food tastes fresh and delicious! The food came to our table in about 15-20mins. Pet friendly on the patio! Should've brought my pup here! Service is fantastic, always on time with refills and attentive with anything we needed. Only downside is the parking lot, it's very limited. We were lucky we were staying in the inn next door.5/5 stars from us!!

I love this place! The service is great and the food is mouth-watering goooood. The crepes are unique and very generously portioned. I got the shwarma & gyro crepe and the flavors were amazing. I love their crepe because it's not too thin so it doesn't collapse or become soggy from the filling. The crepe has a tinge of sweetness to it that I like. Try the dirty chai latte - it's a chai latte with a shot of espresso. It is so yummy and a tasty pick-me-up during the middle of a work day. Their garlic fries are okay - I'd skip that and go for a different side.

My family and I have been eating there for close to 15 yrs, my mother really love's it. You can't go wrong with the lunch special all you can eat. One time up is normally enough food, it helps to get two bowls on your tray, one for the meats and the other for the veggies. White rice, pita bread and some type of egg soup with corn comes with the order. The flavors are amazing. I use almost all the spices garlic, curry, cooking wine,lobster sauce house sauce you name it .. We ate there yesterday for my mother's birthday and afterwards I picked up our favorite Mango Cake from (Diamond Bakery) in Monterey Park.

I came here when there were 5 food trucks lined up in Granada Hills on Chatsworth/Zelzah. I wanted to try more than one truck so I was only able to try the Munch Fries.Munch Fries - fries topped with a champagne cheese sauce, pastrami, pickles, and deli mustard. It's a heart attack waiting to happen. If you do get one from this, at least you got one from eating something amazingly delicious! The pastrami was surprisingly juicy, tender, and not salty. I didn't expect a food truck to have such good pastrami.yelp.com/biz_photos/y1tw This truck is definitely worth another visit to try the rest of the menu.

Absolute must if you're in the west LA (or Los Angeles for that matter) area! This African-halal-Mexican fusion is by far one of the best things I've had considering I've lived in LA all my life. To start I love the remote location from the city's bustle, don't let the area fool you from walking in. chef Zadi and his wife are the sweetest and very welcoming. I tried the falafel tacos and the cilantro yogurt chicken, they absolutely delicious. Sooo good! Zadi tells you which condiments to place on your food! Will definitely come back, and recommend it to all!!

Service at this place was less than par. Food was incorrectly given and mixed up with another table. Our drinks didn't arrive until after the food had arrived and removing finished dishes seemed to be a great task for the staff. However, the saving grace for this place was their food. We tried their empanadas (carne and kimchi) and the veggie mushroom arepas; which were quite a delicious prelude to our main dishes of beef ribs over coconut corn and the dirty dog topped with a pineapple slaw. Our drinks were a great pairing to the combination of flavors as well. Overall, a good experience.

Yay! Super close to my house and open late! Was worried at first because some of the reviews said chicken was dry but u should try it urself! Chicken was juicy and crispy on the outside! And nice thick piece too! You can choose from mild medium and spicy, I got medium and it's just the right amount of spice at the end of each bite! Everyone there was super nice too. Got it to go but you can eat there as well. Shall be coming again when I have a late night craving. Thanks guys! ( also I dropped a 20 there now I'm sad :( )

Super cute little brunch place! Always drove by it on the way to work but never had a chance to try it until recently. If the weather is nice I would definitely recommend sitting in their outside area cause it's a really nice garden area with a chill ambiance. Food was pretty good, I got the omelette with chorizo, potatoes, and some sort of chili and cheese with the potatoes gratin on the side (hopefully spelled that right...) Portions are pretty big so no need to worry about enough food. Service was good, our server and waitress were really nice and helpful and overall would come back again!Also the free latte with an omelette is definitely a win :)
